Reviews.Title: “Great Family/Business/Vacation Hotel Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: vsd42
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel is amazing, located near so much! The train is a few blocks away. Hotel is a newer property of Springhill and Residence Inn combined. The staff are extremely helpful, the reception and the ladies at breakfast are pleasant. The lobby is functionable and cozy. Fireplace and Wii for the kids. BREAKFAST is the best meal of the day at Springhill Suites. Seriously, the best selection from a hotel breakfast. Mini fridge and microwave in the rooms. WiFi connection in the rooms. This maybe a small point but you can actually open a bottom portion of your window to get fresh air! Chicago is a city with hotel and restaurant choices a-plenty, this one is comfortable and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Too Many Misses But Worth The Money for the Location in Downtown /Chicago”
Reviews.Author: emsiess
Reviews.Content: Hotel had high school swim meet team which we found out at check-in when the lobby was packed with kids. We know we were in trouble when we saw this. See some of my misses below to explain: Hits: 1. Great location. You can walk 3 blocks to the "L" or 3 blocks to Michigan Avenue shopping. Tons of restaurants in the vicinity and even a whole foods about 5 blocks away. 2. Very nice breakfast included with the room. Served Canadian bacon and eggs one morning and had an oatmeal machine...(didn't like the start of breakfast at 7:30 though, too late for us early risers). 3. Great rate, we paid around $100 a night which is great for the area including the breakfast. 4. Workout room is great. Tons of equipment, modern and very nice room on the 27th floor. 5. Horrible parking fees, but what do you expect in Chicago. 6. Nice to have a mini fridge and microwave, but the fridge never really was cold and did not have temperature control. 7. Thermostat controller was great in the room, we had air condition on since the room was very warm for some reason even though the outside temps were in the 30's. 8. Room was very clean. 9. Great wireless internet connection. No issues and worked great. Misses: 1. Yellow bag of liquid outside the room one morning. Gross and disgusting. Pizza boxes were also scattered outside our room door. 2. Asked the front desk for a quiet room, never received one. 3. Asked the front desk for some extra shampoo, never received it and they just couldn't give it to me when I asked for it in the lobby. 4. 2. Pool is too small to swim, whirlpool was small and old. 3. After an early breakfast, we returned to our room around 8:30 AM and the maid was already in our room? Why they couldn't plan to clean the rooms that checked out first? We had to wait in the hall. Yes, we didn't place the "Do not Disturb" on the door, but we returned to the room by 8:30 in the morning. 4. Room was very small. It is called a suite, but very small. 5. Room only had a shower, no bathtub. 6. Water pressure in the sink was horrible. Takes double the time to shave due to low and controlled low water pressure. 7. Too much noise in the halls from the kids and the pool area was always packed. The small pool is shared by the Residence Inn which is attached to the SpringHill. 8. Never received my bill under my door on check-out day. I expect this from Marriott's so I don't have to stand in line in the lobby. I had to stand in line in the lobby. 9. Too few towels. Only two sets of towels were provided. I requested more towels from the hotel, still waiting for the towels. 10. Needed to print out airline boarding passes. Had to go to the lobby which had 1 printer and 3 computers, 1 of which was down. Computers were used by the students most of the time that I observed so I had to return to the lobby numerous times until I could gain access. Once I did, I couldn't print since the printer had a margin issue and never was able to adjust the margins. Had to waste time and print boarding passes at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: traveljenChicago
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the end of February and enjoyed the hotel. The location is perfect. Walking distance to great food and entertainment. The room is a bit small, but clean and well appointed. Loved the wet bar and ipod docking station. The breakfast was good and made better by the very friendly staff! The front desk seemed understaffed but very friendly. For the price I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Night in the city”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveler80
Reviews.Content: I am from Chicago suburbs but often stay in hotels downtown for events with work or friends. I have stayed at almost all of the Marriott level 5 hotels in Loop / River North and this one was my favorite by far. The location is great for night life - right by many of the best restaurants, bars, clubs, and House of Blues. We have room on 25th floor with terrific N and E views of the city / lake. Free breakfast was nice. There were a LOT of people at the breakfast area on a Sunday morning (it is a 27 floor hotel) but they managed it well. The room I had was nice. It had separate sitting area with a small wet bar and a separate bedroom (not separated by a door, but felt like 2 different rooms). Beds were average - what you'd expect from this level of hotel. All in all, I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone looking for a good hotel not wanting to spend a ton of $.

Reviews.Title: “This is the Place to Stay the Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Kora S
Reviews.Content: I attended activities and a parade by day, and an excellent hotel and staff by night! I stayed with a friend and the size of the suite was perfect, and the breakfast was amazing! The front desk staff were extremely nice, welcoming, and knowledgeable! I can't wait to stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, consistent, will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Kroc123
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Springhill Suites twice now and each time has been great. The rooms are clean and very comfortable. The staff, especially the doormen, are friendly and funny. The location is convenient to Michigan Ave and many other popular attractions, as well as the Red Line and bus stops. I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service ...great location”
Reviews.Author: swede52
Reviews.Content: My daughter, granddaughter, and I went to Chicago for the weekend. From start to finish our stay at the hotel was wonderful. The service, the great and plentiful free breakfast, the cleanliness and the location were excellent! Only a few blocks from Mag Mile and many restaurants nearby. The room was large and modern, the pool VERY clean, I loved the security, too. Wouldn't hesitate to stay again. I plan to!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: TFtraveler_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Springhill Suites for 2 nights as part of a business trip to Chicago. The hotel was clean and conveniently located. Both bus and el-train public transit was located closeby. Lots of great restaurants and shopping also close. I had a corner suite on an upper floor that had great views of the city. The bathroom was spacious and clean. There was no wireless in the rooms, but free wired internet and wireless in the lobby. Will definitely try and stay there again on my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for Winter break weekend”
Reviews.Author: fun2gogal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice for families. The suites are a bit smaller than some but it has a pool, hot tub and a great free continental breakfast. It was the best breakfast I've had. They had waffles with not only syrup but strawberries & whipped cream. An oatmeal machine which I've never seen & toppings. They had bagels, english muffins, scrambled eggs, cheese & sausages plus fresh fruit, yogurt and cereals. The location was great with numerous great restaurants close by. We went to both the Field Museum & Shedd's Aquarium. They were only a short taxi ride away. Michigan Ave. was only a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Guests”
Reviews.Author: Matricewbl
Reviews.Content: Our daughter's recent wedding in Chicago included a heavy percentage of out-of-town guests. We reserved 35 rooms, including a 5-day stay for the parents of the wedding couple, and the bride and groom for the wedding weekend. We were extremely satisfied with the clean, contemporary rooms and their spectacular views. And we were even more satisified with the cooperation of the staff from planning, to valet service and housekeeping. Breakfast was excellent and the dining room large and comfortable for family and friends to gather. The location was ideal for all our guests

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Lives Up to Expectations of a Marriott Property”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedWarrior
Reviews.Content: The rooms have everything one needs and then some. Nicely laid out rooms with a seating area separated from the bed by a desk and floor to ceiling divider, a microwave, small under-counter refrigerator (no freezer), coffee-maker, and bar sink. Bathrooms have a surprisingly large walk-in shower. Complimentary breakfast is included and dining area has pleanty of tables and space. Lobby area is spacious. Shares the same building with Residence Inn. Only one very minor inconvenience- no ice machines or vending on the room floors-it is necessary to go to the lobby floor and request ice which can be slightly inconvenient because the hotel has 27 floors. It isn't a matter of going down the hall to the ice machine and back in 30 seconds. Aside from that it's clean, comfortable, with a friendly staff and well located in the River North area close to restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to walk to Chicago attractions”
Reviews.Author: WiderVistas
Reviews.Content: My favorite part of the Springhill Suites River North was their location. Walking distance to Millenium Park, State Street, Mag Mile, and the great restaurants on Ohio Street which we could see out our window. It truly was a great home base to do so many things in Chicago. On top of that, the value was incredible and the room felt like a mini studio apartment that took advantage of the space so well that I felt like we were in a James Bond lair on a Blimp. The mini living room & desk were separated from the bedroom area by frosted glass panels that could slide open or closed. The TV swiveled so you could watch it from the couch or bed. The shower was the best (but no tub - so ask for that if you want one). There was even a wet bar, fridge, microwave, coffee maker etc. for the price of a value hotel. Not to mention real mugs/glasses in the room instead of plastic cups. Thank you, too, Marriott for limiting the styrofoam at breakfast by having paper plates and paper containers for the awesome oatmeal bar. Please consider paper or other eco-friendly options for the cereal, coffee & tea. (We brought down the mugs from our room.) The lobby and breakfast area were spacious and comfortable. There was a fire place, a Wii station, and computers for internet/boarding passes. Front desk and housekeeping staff we ran into were very friendly, but the two doormen were too busy chatting to open the door for us on an incredibly cold, windy, snowy day. Tip: If you want a snack, the food in their "market" is pricey and there are no vending machines... consider the seven eleven a few doors down from the hotel to stock up.

Reviews.Title: “NYE retreat”
Reviews.Author: nguyens
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for NYE weekend. It was nice we had a suite with a king bed and a sofa in the living area. It is a bit on the small side and not a lot of room to store luggage. Bathroom had a shower only no tub. Breakfast was crowded we went outside and next door to Enstein Bagels. The neighborhood is great for bars and restaurants. Not a bad walk to Michigan ave. Room was VERY clean. For a place to crash and do some shopping it is great. It was only about $100 a night.,,,quite a value in chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience every time!”
Reviews.Author: msrcfam
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to Chicago a few times a month since September of last year and have chosen to stay at the Springhill Suites Chicago Downtown / River North every time. I have never been disappointed. From the moment you check in you feel like a VIP. The staff is attentive and helpful. If you need to know where ANYTHING is in Chicago you can ask and they know! The rooms are clean and spacious. As a frequent traveller, it is nice to have not only a coffee machine in the room, but a fridge and microwave as well. The hotel is located in a great area. It is within walking distance to so many restaurants and hot spots. If you are looking to get out and see the sights that Chicago has to offer, you will not be disappointed either. You can walk to many sights or jump on a train. If you are not sure how to get to where you want to go just ask the staff (as I said, they know everything). I would highly recommend this hotel for any business or leisure trip!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend”
Reviews.Author: Gisele W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took the train from Dearborn MI to Chicago and stayed at the Springhill Suites Chicago Downtown which was only an $8.00 cab ride and truly had an amazing weekend. This hotel is centrally located within walking distance of all the restaurants, night life and shopping. The concierge was truly amazing, he supplied us with great suggestions for dinner, free entrance to Howl at the Moon (which was steps away from the hotel) and a free bottle of wine to celebrate our anniversary. The breakfast selection could have been better because I cannot eat gluten foods and I am also lactose intolerant. The king size bed in our room was not very comfortble (too bouncy), however we made due. Great price too. Always pleased when we stay at a Springhill Suites Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “chicago gem”
Reviews.Author: Peter C
Reviews.Content: Always friendly staff, true value for the money at springhill in great restaurant area. Don't overpay for stuffy 'brand name' hotels. This hotel is clean, great lobby, complimentary breakfast at great rate. Only 5 mins walk to most downtown offices.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: brunospba
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, amazing staff !! good value for your money! Great indoor pool and jacuzzi. Free wifi ! good enough breakfast, not great though

Reviews.Title: “convenient and handy”
Reviews.Author: connie w
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights during a conference and loved the amenities-- all day long coffee and tea at the lobby, free internet, and warm breakfast. The suite is not big but has all we need -- refrigerator, microwave, iron, and hair blower. The room is clean, bright, and most of the time quiet. The only thing we might want to complain is the music during weekend nights. We were not sure where the music came from. It sounded like from a bar or pop in the hotel. Although we still could fall asleep with the music, I am sure it will certainly bother some light sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “It was good but not great”
Reviews.Author: LibragirlMissouri
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between Christmas and New Year's for two days. It's in a great location, right by the Chicago River and only a few blocks from Michigan Ave. There are many restaurants and activities within walking distance. Check-in was easy. We were early but our room was ready. The suite isn't very big. More like one big room with a desk and partition dividing it. The decor was nice and the room was clean. It had one of those bathrooms where the sink is outside of the bathroom and the toilet and shower were together. I personally don't like that. I like a regular bathroom setup. Also, since there wasn't a bathtub we had to give our two year old a shower instead of a bath and that was incovenient. Not sure if other rooms have bathtubs..... The first day we were out all day and when we got back to our room, housekeeping still hadn't cleaned the room. We had to go and find them for toilet paper & towels. The second day they knocked on the room early and we told them to come back later in the day. The proceeded to knock again an hour later. Inconsistent service. All in all it was a good stay for the price we paid. I would stay there again but would find out if they have rooms with bathtubs!

Reviews.Title: “Cramped for 4 adults”
Reviews.Author: angerandhope
Reviews.Content: My family (4 adults + a 1-year-old) stayed here for 3 nights the week between Christmas and New Year's Eve. I pushed for this hotel since I had stayed at (and loved) the adjoining Residence Inn a couple of years ago with friends and loved it...however, our room at Springhill Suites seemed a bit inferior and was cramped for us. The fact that this hotel had a sofa bed as well as the king size bed was a selling point for us, but the sofa bed wound up not being used - we unfolded it and discovered the mattress couldn't be more than 3-4 inches deep, and would definitely not be comfortable to sleep on, so we slept on the couch instead. Another issue we had with the room was that, despite having the air conditioning on and set at 68 in December, the room was still quite warm, mostly due to the fact that there was only one vent that we could find, and it was way over by the window, not allowing for adequate air flow. Breakfast was delicious, convenient and filling - if you got down there early enough to not have to spend a lot of time in line or trying to find a place to sit. The fact that there was an indoor swimming pool at this hotel was also a selling point, as it is hard to find downtown Chicago hotels with one, but when my family went to the pool to swim, they couldn't stay in the water longer than 10-20 minutes because it was so cold. The location of the hotel was excellent; there are 2 Starbucks within a block and a half radius of the hotel, several sit-down restaurants (including Harry Caray's and Rosebud Trattoria on the same street) and a few casual dining places nearby as well. The red line is a few blocks northeast and you can get on the purple and brown lines a couple of blocks west. The Magnificent Mile is not a far walk to the east, either. All in all, I would recommend this hotel for groups that wouldn't need the sofa bed - I would come back and stay by myself, for example, but I wouldn't stay here with my family again. Just much too crowded for more than two people.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a great price.”
Reviews.Author: jajbrown40
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a night out on Dec. 29th. Requested and received a room on a high floor, with a nice view of the city. We stayed in a studio suite, which was perfect for our needs. The staff was very friendly and helpful, but I'm not sure how we would have received our luggage if we had not gone back to the valet area and picked it up ourselves. When we arrived, we left our bags with the valet, who said he would bring them up. (You have to go up to the second floor to check in.) So we left them there, and when we checked in, mentioned it to the clerk, who then asked for our receipt. Unfortunately, we had not been given one, (just our parking ticket.) He said not to worry about it, but I went down and retrieved them anyway. Not sure how they would have matched my bags to my room. The carpet in our room was just a little dark and dated, but the room was clean, and bright otherwise. Bathroom facilities were adequate, nice shower. I was a little frustrated that the coffee pot in the room made only one cup at a time, and we were given only enough regular coffee for one cup. (The other packet was decaf.) The room was quiet, only heard a siren once in the night from the street level. It also had a nice couch/chaise for reading and relaxing. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ncarole3
Reviews.Content: I was in town with several other people for New Years week-end. We had a total of three rooms (two were side-by-side per our request) and everything was great. The staff was very friendly, the service was good, the River North location is great, and they had a good complimentary breakfast. We all liked the place and would definitely stay there again! One of the reviews commented that it was not a good place to stay for business. That may be the case...but it was New Years Ever after all! I doubt you could find a "quite" place in that part of town on New Years Eve!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sona E
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed. We stayed from Dec 29-Jan1. The lobby was great, very large, with lots of couches, tables, some televisions, --great for just hanging out, gathering with friends, etc. There's even a Wii in the lobby, too. We also enjoyed the rooms. We were up high, and had a great view of the city. The hotel is 27 floors, so I would recommend a high floor. It's a new hotel, built in 2008, so everything is new and in great shape. Location is great. Beds are comfortable, as was the pullout couch. There are microwaves and minifridges in all rooms, however we did have problems with our fridge not getting cold, even after the second replacement. To their credit, they came promptly and replaced it, finally with a larger unit that did get cold. The pool area is small, and with a full hotel, it was too crowded. Quality of breakfast was fine good, with a nice variety to choose from, however, at peak times, with a full hotel, would suggest getting to the buffet early, as there were really long lines. All staff is very friendly and customer service oriented. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good in many ways.”
Reviews.Author: chicagotravels
Reviews.Content: Just did a mini-vacation with our adult kids staying at Springhill Suites. We had 3 rooms in our reservation, we requested (and received) the rooms near one another on a high floor. Rooms are very adequate for a downtown location. The staff was friendly, the breakfasts are what you'd expect (a variety of cold cereals, a waffle maker, muffins, etc.). The only thing I had an issue with was the elevators. The hotel was booked full (at least it appeared that way) as there was always a wait for the elevator. Other than that, great location, friendly staff, etc. I would have no qualms about staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Jay083
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights with family between Christmas and New Years. Had 2 rooms reserved, but only one was ready at check-in; other was not ready until 5 PM. Not a big deal for us, and front desk staff was very friendly and helpful despite crush of guests all arriving at around the same time (hotel was full). Very good location; left car in (expensive) garage the whole time. Short two-block walk to train station (stop at CVS on the way to buy transit passes - $4.75 for one day covers trains, subways, and buses, but NOT the Metra trains along the lakeshore). Two blocks in other direction is the Michigan ave. shopping district. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Hot tub was broken 1st night, but was fixed next night. Breakfast was good, though crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again....but”
Reviews.Author: Dave O
Reviews.Content: Overall experience at this hotel was nice. On the positive side, great location, clean rooms, pleasant and helpful staff (with one exception), nice continental breakfast which was well stocked. On the negative side, I requested early check-in, but did not arrive until 4:15pm (check in time began at 3pm). My room was not ready and the excuse given to me by the front desk clerk was that the hotel was "usually busy". Granted, my stay was during the time between Christmas and New Years, so the hotel was busy, but I worked for a hotel for 2 years. We knew our busy times and our slows times. I have a better term for this: Mismanaged. While the pool/whirlpool does have a nice view from the 27th floor, it's on the small side given the number of people that were there. Also, because of how busy the hotel was, there were lines to get what you wanted at breakfast and it was hard to find a place to sit. Would I go back again? Probably. Maybe during a different period where the hotel is not so busy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little getaway”
Reviews.Author: Matt B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel Tuesday through Thursday(today) and had a great time! Hotel was in a great location that was basically steakhouse central in the River North area. Nice soft bed and a mini fridge and microwave in every room. Nice updated bathroom and free wi-fi also! Complimentary Breakfast was good but it was a madhouse in there due to a lot of families off work and school in town for Navy pier and museums. Great little bars close by also. Would stay again any time!

Reviews.Title: “Probably nice for families, but stay away if you want a calm, professional place”
Reviews.Author: liz978
Reviews.Content: Nice enough hotel and clean room, but the hotel seemingly was packed with families, teens and college students -- not good for the business traveler. I was in town on business, with a full day of behavioral field research ahead of me on a Sunday. I needed a quiet place to keep well on Saturday night. Instead, after dodging loud kids in the elevators and passing many loud rooms, I thought my room was safe and quiet. Nope, I had to call security Saturday night at 1 a.m. when the college-age girls in the room next door to me returned drunk and decided to have a shrieking, crying, "You slept with my boyfriend, you [insert explicative of choice]!!!" knock-down, drag-out fight complete with the sounds of furniture banging. To the hotel's credit they sent security up immediately and I didn't hear anything afterwards. On Sunday morning, the hotel was teeming with families trying to check and the elevator literally stopped on 19 of the 22 floors on the way down, with no one able to fit after 3 stops. After 10 minutes of riding the elevator, the breakfast room was so crowded with what appeared to be nothing but kids in the 10-22 year old age range and a few parents, I gave up and went to Einstein Bagels next door. What knocked this down from average to poor for me is the odd shaped room and terrible lighting, especially the glaring fluorescent light over the bed. I ended up awkwardly moving the desk lamp over to the bedside table so I could enjoy bedside lighting more appropriate for reading and unwinding. Things were better after the weekend when all the kids checked out, but pay heed to all the terrible/ poor/ average reviews by folks who weren't in town for a special shopping and theatre (or bar hopping) weekend in Chicago. I'm sure if you're looking for a good value for a family-friendly place, where you plan to stay out late, be noisy, order pizza and watch TV this is a good value for the price, but I won't be letting my company book me here again - I will try a different Marriott brand if I end up in Chicago again.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: IndyAdam
Reviews.Content: I traveled in Dec 2011, with wife and 4 kids, 10 and under. Very helpful staff with great recommendations-food, entertainment. Convenient parking. Great hotel for traveling families with young kids. Nice pool on top floor with great views. Nice open lobby with a great hot breakfast (lots of choices). Fast elevators. Extra security features make you feel safe. Will definitely return again with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff! Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Goodeats68
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually two hotels in one. One side is the Springhill Suites and the other is the Residence Inn. They share the same lobby. Everyone on the staff is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast area is nice with a lot of choices and very friendly staff. The rooms are nice and clean,very friendly housekeepers. My first impression was the room was small, but it worked for us as we didn't stay in the room alot. The rooms have everything you need small area with microwave, fridge, and sink, sofabed, desk and chair and the bathroom sink is seperate from the toilet. The hotel is close to everything, including one of my favorite resturants-Ruth's Chris Steakhouse across the street. There is also a cool piano bar across the street too, Howl at the Moon (get there early). A couple days after our stay I got an email from the General Manager making sure we had a wonderful stay. My only complaint which is no fault of the hotel is the complimentary breakfast area is BUSY on the weekends!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great trip!”
Reviews.Author: mackenna65
Reviews.Content: I travelled let month with my daughters, age 8 and 10. We were thrilled with this hotel. The location is perfect for getting to both Michigan Ave and State St. Grant Park is an easy walk as well. The hotel had everything we wanted, plenty of space and I loved having a fridge and microwave. The staff was super friendly and helpful, breakfast offered many choices and room service was very reasonable-something I don't usually do and we were exhausted. This is our new favorite hotel in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: travels4jen
Reviews.Content: My mom and I just returned from a nice trip to Chicago to enjoy the seasonal atmosphere of the city. I've stayed in the Residence Inn side before and decided to try the Springhill Suites side this time. Both are very nice hotels with great amenities. I must say though, the Springhill Suites was a little more comfortable. It had more a 'relaxed' feel to its lobby, and spacious breakfast area. The staff was very pleasant, always smiling, and helpful. The full hot breakfast was wonderful as always, and the dining area was a good bit larger. We had a very nice, clean, and quiet room on the 25th floor with lovely city views. We chose to stay at this property again because of its great service, but most of all its perfect location! Only a 10-15 minute walk to almost any major attraction...parks, shopping, dining, as well as the train station. Next time I'm in Chicago, I'll definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “traveling in group”
Reviews.Author: nanana
Reviews.Content: Excellent option for Downtown Chicago. We arrived in O'hare, took the blue line train and walk a couple of blocks to the hotel. It's a modern place with a great breakfast area (it was included for us). The Breakfast was good, buffet with fruits, cereal, eggs, waffles, yogurt, toast, bagels, etc.it work beautifully for us being a large group (12 people) because at least at one meal there was no discussion about where to eat! The rooms had an small "kitchen area", with microwave, fridge and coffeemaker, and small sitting area with a sofa bed that worked fine as a bed for the 3 nights we stay there. The bedroom dedicate area was very good and had great bathroom. The room 2618 has beautiful views of the Wrigley Building. We were very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay when going to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: I receently have the privilege of staying at the Springhill Suites. My room was clean and comfortable. The staff was very upbeat, genuinely pleasant and very proffessional. The neighborhood offers Chicago at its finest with an abundance to see and do. I vivt Chicago often and this is now my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service and Sales Support!”
Reviews.Author: Bob B
Reviews.Content: With a year in Chicago (Mon thru Thurs) at the Springhill Suites, I think I can say that the service level provided by Sean (Front Desk) and Melanie (Sales) have been exemplary on all levels. Sean identified my room preferences in the first week or so and I have never had to even ask the question again when I've arrived on Monday nights. In addition to the incredible level of service, there is always a genuine sense of interest about my experiences in Chicago and the rest of my schedules. It is greatly appreciated. Melanie (Sales) has made sure that our team that is staying at the Springhill Suites has the correct billing and rates in place (in spite of our confusion at times) and just recently made sure that we would get the same level of support on our next assignment (and found us a great rate at another Marriott property!).

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: mentormom59
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I came to Chicago for the first time for her tour and portfolio review at SAIC. We had no idea what to expect at the Springhill Suites, but decided the location and number of points it would take to stay made it worth the chance. We were very pleasantly surprised by the stylish decor, roomy accommodations, VERY FRIENDLY and helpful staff and extra safety precautions which made me more comfortable traveling as 2 women alone. The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because of the VERY noisy night club next door which kept me awake on the evening that they opened their roof - to enjoy the lovely night! Request an even numbered room and you will avoid this issue - also request a high floor! We will DEFINITELY make this our go to place in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Leslie H
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great from start to finish. Friendly and helpful staff. Inviting lobby and breakfast area. Nice choice of food for breakfast. Fabulous coffee available all day long! Fast internet. Good tv channels. Comfortable beds. Clean laundry room. Well stocked gym. Perfectly maintained and right temperature pool and hot tub. It was an entirely enjoyable stay. Great neighborhood too! I can't find a single negative thing to say! All good stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: cran
Reviews.Content: Located north of the river and central to all attractions in the Loop area. Nicely furnished, clean and comfortable. Only issue is noise of the traffic and crowd on Saturday night after a college football game when rooters honk and shout to the wee hours. You enter on the street level to the valet attendant and take the elevator one flight up to the main lobby and then a second bank of elevators (room card needed) to get to your room. This provides an additional level of security. The free breakfast is good. We walked to the Field Museum, Willis Tower, Art Institute, Shedd Aquarium, Miracle Mile, and took the train from Milllenium Station to the Science Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Don F
Reviews.Content: Stayed Oct 28th for a getaway with wife and our two grandkids. Front desk could not have been any better. Checked in early and they had a room available. Wife wanted a higher floor room and told us after our trip to Lincoln Park, a room would be available. Returned around 4 pm and received a room on the 25th floor facing the lake. Location is great, close to everything necessary or a short bus ride. Bus to Lincoln Park Zoo was right out front. Gino's pizza East around 10 blocks and worth the walk. The staff could give seminars on running a Hotel, couldn't have been more pleased with all the service we received. Room was clean, king bed comforable and with Ref and Microwave in room was a bonus. Will continue to stay and plan on staying a few days next time.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, Bad managment!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bryan H
Reviews.Content: DONT STAY HERE IF YOU ARE A HARD WORKING PERSON TRYING TO HAVE A GOOD TIME!!!!! THEY RUINED MY WEEKEND AS WELL AS POSSIBLY MY CREDIT! First off, the hotel itself is really nice for the price. I decided to surprise my girlfriend for our 3 year anniversary and take her to Chicago. I booked Springhill suites a week before and after reading all the reviews, i was so excited to get there! I requested an early check in time(which we got A+ there) and also a high floor room. Upon check in, we were told that the highest floor they had was the 5th floor. Keep in mind that i upgraded to the Corner Suite. I figured being in the fall, they tried filling up the first floors first. after we got settled in, we found new friends in the elevator and said that they also booked a week before and got a corner suite on the 18TH FLOOR! I don't know if it was because me and my girlfriend were only 21 and the hotel thought they could put us anywhere just because we were young or what. Also keep in mind that i am a full time college student working 30-35 hours a week just to support my girlfriend and i. Later that night i checked my bank account and THEY CHARGED ME $120 MORE THAN WHAT THEY SAID THERE WERE GOING TO WITHOUT ACKNOWLEDGING IT! i complained at the front desk and they said they took extra out because that if i charged anything to the room, then it would taken out of the extra charge amount and that they would credit my card a couple days after i checked out. I have never heard of this from others hotels. This is where i really lost respect for this hotel. I have a student loan i pay monthly and being that they took the extra $120 out, i spent the weekend calling friends and family seeing if they could loan me the money until Marriot credits my account back. I will never again stay at this hotel or any other hotel owned by marriot because of what they have done to me. I would rather spend my hard earned money in a dump hotel rather than give them the right to try to ruin my young life. If i would have know about this before, i would have chosen somewhere else. PLEASE SAVE YOURSELF THE HASSEL AND STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a very nice hotel with good rates.”
Reviews.Author: Jeffwhatever
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in September for two nights for leisure. First, let me say the location of this hotel is great. It's right on Hubbard where you will find numerous bars, nightclubs and high-end restaurants all within a short walk. Michigan Ave is a medium walk or short cab ride away. The hotel itself is clean, and the staff is very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are nice. For a 3.5 star hotel the rooms, in my opinion, are just as good if not better than some of the 4-star hotels I've stayed at in the area. They call it a suite, but it's really a queen bed on one side, and couches on another that are separated by a work desk with sliding glass (see pics), but the nice added feature is the 'wet bar' or kitchenette. It includes a microwave, sink and small fridge which you don't usually get in a 4-star. Public transportation is also a short trip in any direction. CTA bus stop is a block away and will take you way North, and Red Line stops are a short walk if you're going to the Cubs or Sox game. You can't beat the nightlife this is near. It's located in the heart of River North. If you are looking stuff to do, you can't go wrong here. If you're going to hang out north of here, say Gold Coast area, I'd recommend getting a hotel further north, but for Loop/River North access, stay here. Overall, this is my new favorite River North place to stay. Oh, and by the way, this hotel works in conjunction with AAA. The money I saved booking a two-night stay at the AAA rate was enough to pay for a one-year single AAA membership. So I've already broke even and I still get to use the AAA rates throughout the year. I recommend doing this if you travel frequently and stay for more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “For Business or Pleasure, this Property Scores”
Reviews.Author: doug107
Reviews.Content: Chicago is a sports town. While the city's Cub's have not hoisted a trophy in more than 100 years, others teams have been champions and anyone staying at the Springhill Suites has picked a winner. First, the location is great. Going by subway or train was an inexpensive $2.50 each way as opposed to $40+ by taxi. Although a couple of blocks away from the station, with roller bags as common as Michael Jordan t-shirts, the few blocks are not a hassle. Besides, a taxi is just a few bucks from the subway. But once inside the hotel, the place delivers. Arriving early at Marriott properties usually is not a bad idea, but coming in on the Sunday of the Chicago Marathon, meant that many people elected for late departure. In fact, the hotel accommodated those who ran the race with even later than usual check-out. That's a great service and the hotel is commended for it. As a guy who has run a couple of marathons, but finished hours after the winner, the chance to grab a hot shower is welcome. The main level has a series of large windows facing south that let in a plenty of natural light and comfortable chairs if you're just hanging out or waiting for someone. For families with kids who like the Wii, there is a game in the lobby. When I walked through Super Mario was being played. I had a King Suite room. The bed was good -- not great, but more than adequate. The lighting in the room was solid, but could have been better placed. A plus was a clock radio that let me plug in my iPod and use my own play-list to wake up. Nice touch. The TV swiveled great for bed-time watching, but it was a bit off-kilter for watching from the room's couch. Overall, the King Suite was a winner and would have been four stars if not for the TV angle. As with most SpringHill properties, there is free breakfast in the morning. Canadian bacon, or sausage, scrambled eggs and the ever-present waffle maker were the hot choices along with cold cereal, english muffins, mini-pastries and a pretty decent hot oatmeal. I had dinner at Hub51, the restaurant right next door. A meal outside with a mild breeze blowing and air temps around 70 degress was slightly chilly, but the turkey meatloaf was seasoned well, and the fries reminded me of Arby's curly fries. Get the green tea to stay warm. As a runner (although not in the marathon during this visit) a joy of this hotel is that it's less than two miles from Lake Michigan. A dawn run to the lake was great. The sun peaked over the horizon a few minutes after I got there, an early sweat on my brow. The hotel is two blocks from the Chicago River if interested in one of the many floating tours. I hear that they're enjoyable, but I didn't have the time. I heard that the in-house gym at Springhill was pretty good from a guy on the elevator, but I can't be sure. Overall, I give the Springhill Suites a strong score for location, friendly staff and room value.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: TravellerTOCA
Reviews.Content: I have to say I was very pleased with my stay at the Springhill Suites, in fact, this was one hotel where I found all hotel staff, not just the reception staff, extremely polite, pleasant, helpful, and friendly. Great service from check-in to check-out. Perfect location, a few blocks from the subway. Comfortable and well laid out room, also allowed for a perfect work space.

Reviews.Title: “Day away in Chi-Town”
Reviews.Author: CubsFanMichigan
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with a friend to enjoy a relaxing day away while on vacation. I had made a reservation online and had noted my preferences. I had requested an early check in. I arrived about 2pm and was told my room was not available. They took my name and phone number and stated that they would call me when avilable. I understand that its a big city and rooms are sometimes in high demand. I checked my bags at the Front desk and went across the street to Harry Carays. I returned to the hotel at about 345pm and the room was still not available. I waited in the lobby and reapproached the Front desk at 4pm which I believe is either past the check in time or is the check in time. Finally they acknowledged me and got me a room. The Spa ( hot tub ) was out of service. I was told it would be ready in one hour and that never happened. I never ended up being able to enjoy it. The swimming pool liner appeared to be lifting up from the bottom. I thought it probably needed some immidiate service. Anyways, the room itself was modern and clean. The location was pretty good. The best part of this hotel was the price. Certainly not one of my best experiences with a Marriott property. However, the breakfast was good and was available 30 minutes prior than the time advertised. This was much appreciated. Upon checking out, I was never asked how my stay was. I believe that this should be a golden rule of the hospitality industry. Perhaps I am wrong. Overall, I would have to rate this hotel " fair to partly cloudy" in comparison to many other Marriott hotels that I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Such the friendly staff and comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: WCOttav
Reviews.Content: This is a somewhat quirky set-up in that you enter the hotel on Dearborn and have to take an elevator to the lobby. One side of the building is the Springhill Suites and the other side is a Residence Inn. I've stayed at the Residence in before, too. On this recent trip, I was struck by how friendly the ENTIRE staff was, from the front desk, to the room attendants to a lovely woman cleaning up after breakfast was over. Our room was up on the 24th floor with a view toward the lake. The decor was very contemporary and still warm and comfortable. The other Marriott properties are all practically within site of our room (Courtyard, Full Service Marriott) and the Renaissance is close by too. Lots of good Chicago style restaurants & bars within easy walking distance. Really enjoyed my one night there and would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: msrcfam
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here regularly since August and will be staying here throughout January for business. I would stay nowhere else. For the business traveler the hotel is a great price for a great location. Walking distance to any kind of restaurant you could want. The complimentary breakfast and internet service are as important as the location of the hotel For personal travel the location is great for tourist attractions. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms may be a little on the small size, but are very comfortable. All-in-all I would highly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, and well-priced”
Reviews.Author: JSanders4243
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with an innovative approach to combining both Marriott brands. It's middle of the road as Marriott brands go. The rooftop pool is beautiful and the view is great. Rooms are nice, staff is friendly. Cell phone reception from within rooms is horrible, though. Internet is reliable and decent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean with a great locale.”
Reviews.Author: Charlie K
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with good breakfast and amenities for a major city's downtown area. Reasonably affordable....Rooms a bit on small side but ok....Great locale as far as CTA and city's attractions.

Reviews.Title: “great marriott service and style”
Reviews.Author: ST61938
Reviews.Content: This is your typical marriott springhill. the rooms are very clean, and somewhat generic in design. I like the suite format with a separate living and sleeping areas. the service and desk staff at this hotel are impeccable. despite a few hiccups upon checkin, the staff never missed a beat. There was a large convention in town this week and you could not tell from the staff but it was very busy. would stay again, love the location near plenty of eats and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago is a great place to visit.”
Reviews.Author: tiby
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Springhill Suites in Chicago downtown. Our accommodation was clean and fresh. The hotel is located within walking distance of things to see in Chicago. We purchased the hop on hop off trolley ticket for two days. Well worth its value. We were able to see almost everything in Chicago proper and surrounding areas. The hotel breakfast was great and kept us through to a late lunch. The staff were so helpful with our questions and gave us great tips for restaurants in the nearby area. We took the Architectural Heritage Tour which was amazing. Well worth doing. Chicago is a great city and has a lot to offer. The Science and Technology Museum and the Art Museum were also amazing. Chicago is great for shopping as well. You need about 4-5 days to cover everything. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Good plastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: abd1958
Reviews.Content: Shares a building with a Marriott Residence Inn. As plastic hotels go it's fine but not exceptional Best attribute is location.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: adenacb
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Chicago, and this hotel was wonderful. The location was great: we could walk right down to the river or to some of the city's many attractions. We enjoyed the pool and hot tub every day, and the fitness center looked very nice (altho we didn't use it). Especially nice was the included bountiful breakfast each morning -- eggs, cereal, yogurt, and even make your own waffles! Our room was comfortable and clean. My only regret about the room was that I wish there was a dresser or something with drawers for our clothing. Also, the hotel staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel53705
Reviews.Content: Our arrival and check-in went smoothly. Our room package included valet parking but the parking garage is just around the corner and there is an elevator inside the hotel that goes to the parking garage. So you wouldn't have to use the valet service. We stayed in a corner suite with nice views of the city. The furniture is modern and comfortable. There isn't a door separating the bedroom from the sitting area of the suite, like some suites, but there is quite a bit of privacy even if you have someone sleeping on the pull out sofa. There is a small pool and hot tub on the 27th floor near the exercise room. Both were fine and the area was kept clean. The biggest plus for this hotel is its close proximity to a number of restaurants. The front desk staff provided a two page list of restaurants within walking distance when we checked in. The downside, there's a fire station about two blocks away. Sirens and horns are blasting all night long. We found it hard to sleep. We've stayed in Chicago many times and have never been bothered by the noise from cars or passersby like were here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location at a great rate”
Reviews.Author: SJWorldtraveler
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to stay in Chicago, with a great location, walking-distance to all of Chicago's main attractions, this is the right choice! The rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable. The people working at the hotel are always willing to help you and satisfy all of your needs. Will surely stay there in my future trips to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The second visit was as great as the first. We will be back next year!”
Reviews.Author: 1tiredpuppy
Reviews.Content: We returned to this hotel again this year after a wonderful stay last year for our annual girls weekend. The front desk staff is top notch and our room (2421), even though it was handicap, was perfect. A huge bathroom! The beds were very comfortable, fridge for our drinks and a small sofa to relax on. The breakfast is one of the better ones I have seen and even though there are a lot of people eating, it was well stocked. The location of this property can't be beat. You can walk to all the shopping on State street with no problems and there are mutiple train stops within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A little grimy”
Reviews.Author: DenverCO303
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the same model as other recent Springhill suites, with the same light green colors and split room feature. Unfortunately this hotel has not kept up with the cleaning; everything is a little grimy. I did a bedbug check when I got to the room today, and noticed many stains, dirt, etc. There are a lot of stains on the upholstered area at the headboard, on the carpets, and walls. I don't see any bedbugs but it makes you wonder how good of a sign it is if they don't clean well. Too bad, because this could be a really nice Springhill Suites like the Houston Intercontinental Airport one- super clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: FEMAtraveler
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here when we had to take our son to the Children's Hospital, the hotel is beautiful, the rooms are spacious and the view is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Judytraveler13
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Chicago and would go back to the city and to the SpringHillSuites downtown! The hotel was located in a great part of town and it made it very easy to get to all the various attractions! Our room was very clean and had space for us to move around and relax after a busy day in the city. The daily breakfast was always hot and had pleasant staff that helped you with your food items and kept the area very clean. The reception desk was occupied by a variety of staff member and all of them gave us great advice and had directions to get to all our attractions! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great everything...”
Reviews.Author: AcolyteNS
Reviews.Content: Actually stayed here June 2010. Great location â€“ just a few yards from the free trolley to the Navy Pierâ€¦ Nice amenities â€“ Wii for the kids at the front desk, Nice humid swimming pool on the top floor with awesome city viewsâ€¦ Great complimentary breakfast and service. Awesome suite style rooms â€“ comfortably fit a family of 5! Overall, awesome family vacationâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family hotel”
Reviews.Author: coco6419
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to any family traveling to Chicago. Especially those with more than 2 children. The pull out couch was perfect since we have 3 children. The hotel location was ideal. The breakfast also very good and convenient......it was better than the usual continental breakfast at other hotels. The hotel was clean and you can't beat the price for summer in Chicago. It was also very quiet and made for great sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel...shame about the other guests”
Reviews.Author: Edoflyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights mainly for work on my first trip to Chicago. Room had everything I needed, comfortable bed, fridge, good desk space and sofa area. But no safe box. I had a room on 15 floor facing East. The view was good but not spectacular. There is a fire station a block away and the sirens from the fire trucks were slightly annoying. The free wireless was pretty slow and the free breakfast food itself was mediocre but I liked the relaxed style - you could come and go as you please, take the food back to your room and they kept the coffee bar open all day. Service was good. Front desk staff were helpful and there was a very pleasant waitress in the breakfast room. The only thing that would keep me away is the other guests that stayed here. Call me snobby but I found there were too many noisy families with lots of young kids running around.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely coming back!”
Reviews.Author: cthibby
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago for business every week (have been for the past year and a half) and after staying in many different hotels--came upon this gem. The staff at Springhill Suites goes beyond the call of duty, is always extremely friendly and courteous and will make sure that your stay with them is the best it can be. I also really enjoy the spacious rooms, free wi-fi and complimentary breakfast (with an assortment of national newspapers). All-in-all, I would highly recommend the Springhill suites to anyone visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: dsheridan13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights for the Lollapalooza music festival. Upon arriving we were greated by manager who immediately helped us check in, gave us advice on a bar to go to and gave us free passes to Howl at the Moon without us even asking. The room was clean and already cooled down to a chilly 64 degrees which was welcoming in all the heat. We had a king size bed and a pull out sofa, refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker. Not to mention a great view of Dearborn st. The bed was very comfortable and it was quiet. Wifi in room was free and worked great. I was even able to skype with no problems. Breakfast was included and it offered hot as well as cold items. There was a large area to eat and everything was kept clean and well stocked by a very friendly staff member. We also came across various staff throughout the hotel who greeted us with a smile and a "have a nice weekend" The location is very close to a lot of bars and restaurants. There is a lot of activity on the streets at night, but we did not hear any of it from our 14th floor room. It was also a short (20min) walk to Grant Park about 1 mile away. There was a mix of families, couples, singles both young and old at the hotel. I would definitely stay here again. It was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, near the action yet reasonable!”
Reviews.Author: riqstar
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to attend Lolapalooza over August 5th weekend. We decided to stay at the Springhill Marriott this weekend. Great spot, near a lot of nightlife, great pizza and easy to get to Grant Park and other attractions. Great breakfast, great wifi and comfortable beds. Can't complain at the price, decent studio style rooms. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice time”
Reviews.Author: jcr_uchicago
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for the Chicago portion of our honeymoon. We had a nice time. The room was large and clean, the service was good, and the market store in the hotel was useful. Complimentary breakfast each morning was good. The selection of foods was decent, the breakfast staff was friendly, helpful, and quick to clear empty tables. The location was very useful, as so many places were within walking distance. Next time I go back to Chicago, I will likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: nesi248
Reviews.Content: stayed at springhill suites from july 25 to the 28th. family of four with boyfriend along. close to all attractions and the 'EL'. staff was very friendly and helpful.hotel was clean and updated.breakfast great.parking is attached to building with a walkway connection security on parking lot area 24hrs. we will definately stay here next time we go.

Reviews.Title: “Great, great, great”
Reviews.Author: ginasmimi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Spring Hill Suites while spending the weekend downtown. We could not have been more pleased. Check in was prompt, efficient, and Kumar was very helpful and friendly. Our room was on the 7th floor. We had a King studio, which was very clean and accomodating. There was nothing lacking. The location is fantastic. MIchigan Ave., Navy Pier all within walking distance, along with several restuarants. Nothing was lacking at breakfast. Even though it was very busy, everything was well prepared, well stocked and very clean. Veronica is truly a valuable employee who really brightened our morning. We highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: mykidsmom3
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for walking around downtown. The rooms are clean, but small. The largest bed is a double. There is no restuarant or bar in the hotel, but many things in walking distance. The pool is at the top of the building which gives a great view of the city. It's expensive like everything else downtown and parking is an additional fee.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location on the North Side. Make sure you say hi to Veronica. Don't miss Frontera Grill and Xoco a block away!”
Reviews.Author: Snagglepuss711
Reviews.Content: I think I have been finally been convinced to switch away from the Hilton hotels. I have had more inconsistent stays at their hotels. But the Marriotts I have been in lately have all been outstanding. Just before I arrived in Chicago, in fact, I was in Toronto's Eaton Centre hotel, where I had a fantastic 3-day stay. Everything about the Springfield Suites was stellar: the location could not be beat --it's not just close to the classic Lou Malnati's pizza but my favorite Mexican restaurant in the country, Frontera Grill, is a block or so away. While the weather was pretty hot outside, I could always count on a clean, fresh, made-up and comfortable room. The breakfasts were awesome and you guys should hire me as a line waffle cook, since I was so adept at making them. The hot foods were good and everything was refilled and kept delicious. Yes, there were many guests and it was hard sometimes to attend to everyone, but your staff was simply first class. They would come up and ask us how everything was. I liked that there was free and problem-free wireless Internet access in the rooms. Excellent. The coffee was plentiful and nice and bold. Oh and I must mention a staff member named Veronica who went far and beyond the level of service. Veronica normally keeps up the breakfast room, along with the other staffers. I came downstairs around 11 am on Thursday morning (July 21), just as the staff was cleaning up the breakfast room. I asked her if they had taken down the big ice water dispenser that is normally put out for breakfast. Apparently they had. I had my empty water bottle with me and I had planned to simply fill it up as I prepared to tackle the hot downtown streets. Veronica insisted on helping me. She took my bottle and disappeared into the back. It took her a little bit of time and honestly I didn't know where she had gone. In about 5 minutes she appeared with my bottle full of ice water. I'll repeat that again: ICE water. I have no idea she was able to get ice cubes INTO my bottle. It was just the thing I needed because that water was kept colder longer. She went out of her way with effervescence and enthusiasm ---she really wanted to exceed my expectations. As an ebullient representative of the Springfield Suites, I felt she made your hotel shine that day. I know it doesn't sound like much but she really deserved some mention. She needs to be singled out for her terrific care on that hot day.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: NicoleCincy
Reviews.Content: This particular SpringHill Suites is absolutely beautiful. Its also in a great location, right downtown, and near many nice restaurants and bars (including the Dirty martini Bar, my personal favorite!). The staff are very helpful and friendly, and their little food/drink take out area has lots of options, including frozen dinners, which is nice if you need a quick lunch (you can heat it up with the microwave in your room). I love this hotel because of the calming, beautiful colors and fabrics used everywhere. Its very cozy and the views are great. The pool area is a little small, and was filled with noisy kids when I was there, but I would still recommend taking a trip up there (on the top floor) just to look at the views, if nothing else. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “We visited the City from California to celebrate our anniversary & had a FANTASTIC stay!”
Reviews.Author: alwayshappytotravel2
Reviews.Content: The staff from reception to housekeeping could not have been nicer. Breakfast was great a eveyone was VERY accomidating. The hotel location is perfect. Walking distance to music, food, river and public transportion if you want to go down to the musuem campus. Our room was great, stunning view, you could even open the window, nice to get fresh air and hear the sounds of the city. Thanks for a great stay, we LOVED our card!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mjzPa
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend in Chicago with friends. Arrived early morning, couldn't check in but front desk offered to hold our bags until our room was available which didn't happen until 6, although we didn't mind. Rooms were spacious enough and clean with comfortable beds. Hotel is in a pretty good location close to the blue and red lines. Had a free beakfast but it was really crowded so didn't try it. All in all a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Room Block - business”
Reviews.Author: littlemizzy
Reviews.Content: Used Springhill Suites Chicago downtown/River North to block a group of rooms for a business event. Planning was a breeze, Staff were easy to work with and I've been told the hotel is great! Would highly recommend and I will definently use them again (this is our second time).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Amazing price”
Reviews.Author: modernlizbennet
Reviews.Content: You cannot get more bang for your buck in Chicago. The hotel is perfectly located in the center of town, is very classy, has great views, a pool and hot tub, really good service and an amazing (included!) breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Walby
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a 3 day weekend. We spent one day at the Lincoln Park Zoo and Wrigley Field, then onto Navy Pier and Grant Park the next day and this hotel was in the ideal location for getting to all of our destinations. The zoo and Wrigley Field were about a $10-15 cab ride away, and Navy Pier was about a 7 block walk. The rooms are pretty good sized, fairly modern in style, clean, and quiet. Overall, everything in the room was good to very good. Being in downtown Chicago, you'd expect some street noise, but, really the only noise we heard in our 11th floor room was the occasional ambulance or fire truck siren. Oh, there was a FREE breakfast buffet- waffles, eggs, sausage, cereal, bagels, and some fruits. My only complaints are that the tv channels were not in high-def, but you had a fancy flat screen tv to watch; if you're going to have flat screen tv's in the room, why not have a high-def package so that the channels actually come in high-def. Kind of like buying a porsche and never getting past 2nd gear. Also, due to the Springhill Suites and the neighboring Residence Inn sharing the pool/hot tub, the pool area was kind of crowded, and noisy, at times. If you don't watch tv, or if you're not a pool type of person, then my complaints won't matter at all to you. I suppose on a 1-10 scale, I'd give it an 8.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE”
Reviews.Author: rossjames1699
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Breakfast was a great bonus. Very clean and family friendly. Unfortunately, my brother in law, who is military, that was staying in the room next to us, had his car broken in to in the garage that we payed $38 dollars a night for. Window broken and everything. That sucked. They need better security.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for us”
Reviews.Author: molliowa
Reviews.Content: We planned a family Chicago trip with our grown kids and grandkids. This hotel had a decent location for what we wanted to do and offered a king with sofa sleepers for kids. There was a last minute special offered so we booked it. Rooms were small for â€œsuitesâ€� but adequate, as we werenâ€™t spending a lot of time in our rooms anyway. An average free hotel breakfast was included. The pool is pretty small and was jam-packed the two evenings we went. Rooms were clean, staff was friendly and helpful. The nearby fire station had quite a few calls so it was pretty noisy one night.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, efficient for business travel.”
Reviews.Author: KollegeKlubMadison
Reviews.Content: It is a modern hotel, with the updated Springhill Suites rooms. Basically, an ordinary size hotel room (about 400 sq. feet), divided in two with a sitting area/desk/small refrigerator and bar; and the other side a comfy bed, closet and bathroom. My room was very clean, and it was no frills but consistent. Well-lit room, 1 full bathroom and half second. The free (included) breakfast was standard Springhill, with pastries, eggs, yogurt, cereals and the like. The property had a fitness center as well, and a large lobby sitting area. Overall I would return on a business trip for solo traveler because the hotel is consistent with no unwanted surprises. Staff very friendly, and again, room and hotel area kept very clean. Location within walking distance of all Chicago events.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT VALUE, LOCATION AND SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Roadster909
Reviews.Content: For her 21st birthday, my daughter wanted a family weekend in Chicago. This was the first time weâ€™d been there, so location and â€œvisitor-friendlinessâ€� were very important. Springhill Suites exceeded my expectations in every way. The location was great â€“ easy walking distance to the Miracle Mile and lots of restaurants. One of the highlights was walking to the Hancock Center and having drinks in the 96th floor lounge. The room was very nice; clean, quiet and plenty of room for the 4 of us with a king bed and fold-out couch. The staff was excellent and gave us some good pointers for places to go. The desk clerk told us which bus to take to the aquarium and where to catch it. The parking structure was convenient and easy to negotiate. The complimentary breakfast buffet was outstanding â€“ one of the best Iâ€™ve had at any hotel. They offered a wide variety of hot and cold dishes including omelets, sausage, waffles, cereals, fruit, yogurt, etc. Though there were many people eating, the staff kept everything well stocked. The rooftop pool and exercise room were fantastic! And the price was better than any other hotel in the area that I found. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel worthy of my consideration for my next trip to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Keystone_Traveler
Reviews.Content: The River North area of Chicago has many hotels to choose from. I basically ended up here based on a combination of availability, price, and location. Regarding location, visitors to Chicago should seriously consider River North as a good base to center themselves. Close to everything. The River North area also has a great variety of restaurants and pubs. Look at a good map and do the research. The Springhill Suites shares the building with its sister brand, Residence Inn. Lobby registration is on the second floor (enter on Dearborn); walk left off the elevator to the Springhill registration desk; walk right to the Residence Inn registration. The north side of the building is the Springhill Suites. From the outside, the building isn't architecturally pleasing; but the interior is very pleasant and exceeds expectations. The lobby is complete with fireplace and comfortable chairs and sofas. There is a Wii set up for those into gaming. The free breakfast area is in a large area off the lobby. While we're talking about breakfast, no complaints here. Slightly better than average eggs, sausage, oatmeal, waffles, fruit, baked goods, etc. that you usually see at these types of hotels. Check-in was efficient and friendly. Also, the front desk person was very helpful to me by printing out public transportation schedules. I should mention that the Lake/Clark subway (L) station is a short 5-10 minute walk from the hotel. For those who don't mind walking and public transportation, this hotel is served well by public transportaton. I stayed two nights in a room on the 8th floor. Top floor is the 27th, the location of the pool and workout center. Even at the 8th floor level, the view is decent of the John Hancock building, Wrigley Buildin, and other views east. My floor only had a few rooms; perhaps 10 or 12. Not sure if all the floors are like this. It's nice that you don't need to walk far to your room from the elevator. I believe all rooms were occupied and it was very quiet. Either solid walls or quiet people! My room had a King bed so it was more spacious than the rooms with two double beds. The Springhill Suites have a semi-partioned area that serves as a sitting/work area with a desk and sofa (with attached chaise). There is also a sink, mini-fridge, and microwave. Free wired Internet connection (not sure if they had wireless). The bottom portion of the window had two smaller windows that can be "popped" open slightly to get "fresh air." Nice idea, but it was too nosiy to keep them open (despite good weather). When the windows were closed tight, outside city noises were held to a muffled din. City noise was really not an issue for me. The bed was extremely comfortable. Shower water temperature and pressure were very good. Maintenance and cleanliness of the bathroom and room in general were first class. As long as the cost remains competitive, I would definitey consider staying here again during future trips to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service and auto break-in spoils stay”
Reviews.Author: sjukone
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this downtown hotel, over the labor day weekend. Upon arrival, we were quickly greeted and assigned a room, despite being early. This was great and we were thankful. However, after parking the car in the garage attached to the hotel and paying 38 dollars per night for the service, our car was broken into. Unfortunately, we did not find out about the break-in until Sunday afternoon. After speaking with someone from the garage, a police report was filled out. Nothing further could be done, due to the garage manager being off for the long weekend. I proceeded to speak to the hotel manager, Sean. He refused to do anything to help me or compensate me for my situation. Upon insistance, he did refund the price of the parking, but would do nothing else other than offer a beer. I assume the alcohol was to make me forget what had happened. I live 6 hours away from the hotel and know nothing about the area or possible places to have the window replaced. He would do nothing to help, but argue it was not the hotels responsibility and I parked there at my own risk. I later found out 3 other cars had been broken into that day. He knew nothing of this and insisted it was my problem to work out with the garage...that he says they dont own, but their name is all over and they charge guests to use. The following morning, I spoke to another staff, who did find an extremely kind custodian to clean out the broken glass from my car, but I drove home without a window. Luckily, it didnt rain. I would never stay at this hotel again, due to the poor service I received and lack of compassion by the management staff. Further, if crime is such an issue at that garage, they should warn guests prior to them checking in. The garage staff informed me that break-ins were very common and happened almost daily.

Reviews.Title: “Great all around”
Reviews.Author: evenmonkeysfall
Reviews.Content: Great location, price, rooms and free breakfast & internet. Great spot- close to within walking distance of many points of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: topfan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visit Chicago a few times every year for leisure and have stayed at many nice hotels. Our stay at the Springhill Suites was one of the best ever. Without exception, every employee we dealt with had a sincere smile and went out of their way to help us. We were fortunate to get a corner room, which had a great view and was very roomy. It was quiet; we never heard another person. The only thing I would change in the room would be to put in a slightly larger TV, but the one provided was adequate. This hotel is an easy 2 block walk to Michigan Avenue and all the shops. There are many restaurants and bars in the immediate area, providing anything you could want. Two blocks to the south is the Chicago River, providing plenty of opportunity to sight-see, if that's what one is looking for. Parking is, as in all big cities, quite expensive. We used the adjoining garage for self-park and it was $48 for one night. However, there are other less expensive garages very close by (we were too lazy to search them out). Next time we're in Chicago the Springhill Suites will be out first choice.

Reviews.Title: “No frills... and by no frills I mean "NO frills"”
Reviews.Author: cjkingmd
Reviews.Content: This is one of those suite chains that has decided that a trendy lamp makes up for a bad bed, bad customer service and a poorly designed room. No room service, no vending, pay an enormous price in their mini-mart if you want a soda or anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business or your Family”
Reviews.Author: bjsiev
Reviews.Content: Centrally located this hotel is great for both business and family travel. Common areas are clean and comfortable. Breakfast every morning saves you some serious $$.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Good Location, Value So-So”
Reviews.Author: Loriontherun
Reviews.Content: The staff was super friendly and helpful - Absolutely the best thing about the hotel. The hotel shares amenities with the Marriott Residence Inn, which made the pool area very crowded. The pool was very cold, but the hot tub was nice. Although both were very small. Normally an important part of our stay â€“ but a bad experience here. The room was clean, and the view of the city was great. Walk to Michigan Ave wasnâ€™t bad, about 5-10 min. Breakfast was very good. The room didn't have a hair dryer and the beds were uncomfortable. Even our teenager complained. The suite didn't have a separated couch area as advertised - the couch was at the end of the beds - defeated my purpose of not having light in the sleeping area. Hotel was nice, but overall, for what we paid, Iâ€™d look elsewhere before staying here again. We had stayed in a Springhill before and it was worth every penny we paid â€“ this one just wasnâ€™t close to being in the same league.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, and good hotel to go to with kids as well.”
Reviews.Author: MarkHarc
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel, the location was great, they had a WI for my kids to play so I could get some piece of mind, and breakfast was included. Convenient location to the loop and the river north area.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, friendly staff, great location and good value.”
Reviews.Author: 4Visitors28
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were greeted with a level of courtesy and friendliness that was consistently pleasant throughout our stay. The location made getting to local restaurants, Navy Pier as well as to the museums very easy. We had a nice view of the city from our room which was clean and comfortable. The excercise room was very good for our oldest child while the pool provided our youngest with many hours of fun. Each day the breakfast offered many choices for all of us to enjoy. Overall, our experience was very good and we will be staying at this hotel again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “From start to finish, Springhill Suites is always a great experience”
Reviews.Author: BriAnn0921
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, tons of excellent restaurants withing walking distance, great bars, rooms is comfy, quiet and roomy - love the layout with a separate work area and "bedroom". All the amenities, fridge, microwave, big flat screen, wireless or wired internet, big bathroom and the beds are nearly as comfy as mine at home. Springhill has great corporate rates with us and is my go to hotel for overnight stays in Chicago. I spend 2-5 nights per month and when I'm at the Springhill I know that I'll have a great experience (Marriott staff are always excellent but the team at the Springhill are some of their best!) and be well rested.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff make all the difference.”
Reviews.Author: brianmarlies
