Reviews.Content: First impressions from Julio Gonzalez and Will, the two gentlemen helping at curb-side throughout our 4-day stay. They always remembered us, were helpful with bags, cabs and really good suggestions from meals to tourist tricks. Then our check in service, two women at 11:00a.m. on Tuesday, April19. I didn't get their names, but again, they were very accomodating. Hints for a trip to Chicago with a family of 4: bring comfortable shoes and walk where you can (they are short city blocks, don't buy the 3-day trolly bus TRAP, visit the Hancock Building bar (not the observation deck), take the hotel recommendations for low-and-mid-cost meals, plan for MORE TIME at Museum of Science and Industry!

Reviews.Title: “great location, great customer service and accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: mari0929
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times when I visit Chicago. It is very busy, but amazingly quiet in the rooms. The suites are compact, but perfect for my husband and I. I am always greeted warmly and all staff are outgoing and friendly. This hotel has many features including breakfast, workout room, but I especially enjoy the large comfortable lobby with fireplace to sit and relax. The location cannot be beat, especially for walking around downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a meeting”
Reviews.Author: TJTJTJT
Reviews.Content: Just completed a meeting here and highly recommend it. They are very responsive to the needs of the group and offer a hassle-free, well run program, all for a very competitive price.

Reviews.Title: “have bed bugs dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: pookey76
Reviews.Content: I woke up with bites on my body, we were puzzled with what they were and how they got there. We figured it out and they look just like the pics of bedbug bites! Even worse when I went through the bags we had on the floor I found them in our daughters diaper bag. I called the hotel and was told the didnt come from there, that they inspect it blah blah blah. We had to throw out the bags and diapers, I pray none made their way in our home. I am very angry and disappointed in the denial of them coming from the hotel. Funny I was placed on hold every time she needed to comment on what I said. Dont risk stayimg here. We come to Chicago often but will NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Picky_Vickie
Reviews.Content: This property is located in easy walking distance to great restaurants, theaters, attractions and shopping. Attached parking with in/out privileges and breakfast included. The staff here are friendly and knowledgable. Room rates are very reasonable for downtown Chicago. Don't let the "River North" location deter you, it's located in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Chicago downtown”
Reviews.Author: kampan
Reviews.Content: Consider the rate together with it's location, it is value for money. It's clean and modern. And it has a nice and comfortable lobby area, in which I had couple sync-up meetings with business associates. Breakfast area is big and clean as well, it started my days pretty well.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, clean and convenient. But lots of kids!”
Reviews.Author: alstensby
Reviews.Content: For starters, we had what I would consider a VERY good rate for downtown Chicago of $120 a night...especially when you consider it's in the nicer River North area. Keep in mind that if you're driving, you're paying at least $38/day to park your car (self park, $48 for valet), but that's typical of any hotel in downtown Chicago. This does give you unlimited in and out service during your stay.) I'll get the only real "knocks" we have against it out there first. And both are admittedly very neglible. First off, if you're on the lower floors, especially weekends, you will likely hear sirens, horns and such from time to time. We were on the fourth floor. But it never bugged us. But, if you're a light sleeper, it's something to consider. Never heard regular traffic noise though so that's a big plus. The other is only a personal perspective. Due to the easy access and relatively low cost, there were a lot of FAMILIES over the weekend with kids. And not all people control their kids the best. But during weekdays, it's almost exclusively business travelers. Lastly, room storage was pretty minimal for clothing and the likes. One small "closet" and two small drawers that aren't very deep front to back. We had booked a room with two double beds since we were travelling with friends for a concert so the point was literally just somewhere to sleep for two nights. When we arrived, they had overbooked but very quickly fixed it by giving us two separate King rooms which was a nice added bonus. The staff was helpfull and polite. The rooms were very simple but clean and functional. The bed isn't the most comfortable you'll find out there, but they are still very good beds (we just have a very nice one at home). If you're coming in from 90/94, it couldn't be easier to get there and out. It's pretty much a straight shot! If you want something a little bit nicer overall, it's attached to the Residence Inn for Marriot and that's about $20 more a night. In our opinion, the location of the hotel was incredible! For starters, you're in River North. Business is right across the river for that. But if you're going to see/do Chicago, you can't beat it. So many restaurants, parks, museums, etc all within excellent walking distance (we consider that to be up to two miles). Oh...and the pool is a nice touch...when not being taken over by hordes of the afforementioned children. Very small, but with a cool view and a hot tub too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely City Getaway”
Reviews.Author: CityGirl33_11
Reviews.Content: I spent a night with my boyfriend for Valentine's weekend. We both love the city, and we really enjoy this location and the hotel. The staff is incredible - always super polite and ready to help you at any time. The hotel is very accommodating, and the beds are super comfortable. This is my second weekend city stay here. The first was with a group of friends. Even when they are busy, the staff will attend to your needs. It's exactly what I want in a weekend hotel - heart of the city, nearby everything, modern and comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Freqtraveler522
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels for the money that I have stayed at in a major city. It is very clean, quiet and the rooms although not luxurious are very comfortable. Given the location and the quality of the hotel, you cannot go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Mob Scene”
Reviews.Author: BC_Eagle_JD
Reviews.Content: I have written many of these reviews and am convinced that readers are not that ambitious to know what are the stellar qualities of a hotel, its services, and location. They are widely published elsewhere, even by the property itself. Let me isolate some concerns i have about this hotel that the hotel itself might consider rectifying to enhance its hospitality: 1. I realize that hotels thrive on groups, but during my recent visit my colleagues and I had to navigate the lobby and breakfast areas that were filled with sports teams and bridal parties. It might be helpful to encourage these groups not to congregate around the elevator or other passable areas. Too, guests should not be permitted to be playing the Wii or even in public areas drinking beer, no less in bottles! Another way that crowds might be ushered along is to have employees clear tables in the breakfast area. The staff seems to be hidden and could be better utillized. 2. While I appreciate the security the hotel has to access higher floors, I have two concerns. First, what made the hotel designers think it was a good idea to have the security card insert so close to the floor. When you have things in your hand and have to do so much negotiation, it becomes quite an adventure. Secondly, unfortunately, security measures are in place on the "lobby" and "ground" floors, but there needs to be more monitoring of the noise and rowdiness on the upper floors. 3. My colleague and I are Platinum members of the Marriott rewards program. Both of us, to the shagrin of our families, spend over one hundred nights at Marriott properties. Many properties acknowledge our loyalty by a welcome word of gratitude and offer us an upgrade. The front desk staff at this property was interested in finding out what brought us to town rather than acknowledging our loyalty. Might be time for staff development about branding and loyalty programs.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Great_Lakes101307
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here at the suggestion of a friend. We were in town for a surprise birthday party. For the convenience factor we chose to park in the attached parking structure for the hotel and pay the $38/day to park overnight. This was the cleanest and most cheerful parking structure I've ever been in. Checkin was quick and efficient. The guest elevator requires a key car to be swiped prior to pushing the button for the floor you're on- this was a little tricky the first time but we appreciated the added security. The room was modern and spotless. There was a coffee pot, mini fridge and hairdryer The bed was comfortable and my husband and I slept great. The hotel was sold out but the only time it felt crowded was getting to breakfast around 9:30am. It was hectic and there were so many guests in the dining room we took breakfast to our room. Breakfast was not that great so as long as you lower your standards to flavorless egg substitute, bagels, cereal and yogurt you'll be fine. I was a little surprised because I've had a better free breakfast at a $69/night Holiday Inn Express and this facility is way better than Holiday Inn. We would definitely stay here again, we'd just go out for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Another XLNT SpringHill Suite”
Reviews.Author: smcafee
Reviews.Content: Great room layout for the solo traveler; very clean room; very responsive, courteous, and knowledgeable staff; very helpful and courteous doormen; $1/$1 wash/dry; large breakfast room where you can work away from the suite; four complementary newspapers to choose from (local, WSJ, NYT USAT); all amenities worked perfect and appreciated the very quiet hvac; overall a great experience and a fantastic value for short and long-term visits; great decor and style; very comfortable and firm bed; some street noise intrude if you are on lower floors (i was on 10 and could hear muted street noise); fire station is 1 block away so you will here sirens 1+ more times per day; wireless internet speed OK and accessible throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoad4040
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed in this hotel and I love it. The location is second to none. Restaurants, bars and shopping are all within walking distance. The hotel itself is an updated Springhill (the new style) and is very comfortable. The staff was great. I will be staying here again on my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Whether you need to be downtown or not, stay here.”
Reviews.Author: 95817Flyer
Reviews.Content: Anytime I travel anywhere on business and whether or not my temporary office is downtown, that's where I stay. It's the easiest way to get a feel for the city I'm visiting. This hotel is right downtown in the thick of it. Places to eat, drink and listen to music close-by and fairly safe. I used the valet special rate and really enjoyed my stay. They have a awesome staff and well kept building. I slept, ate, and relaxed well here. When I come back to visit, I'll stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more attentive staff!”
Reviews.Author: Diann50
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Chicago, and we had so many questions about restaurants, transportation, neighborhoods, etc. All of the staff was friendly and extremely helpful in answering our questions. The stereotypical myth about "Chicagoans" was dispelled during this visit. We couldn't ask for more attentive staff and comfortable accomadations for a night!

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons Concerning SpringHill Suites Chicago River North”
Reviews.Author: RetiredNavy01
Reviews.Content: Pro's - 1) Great location (Walking distance to Michigan Avenue Shopping, Portillo's, Rain Forest Cafe, Rock and Roll McDonald's, Lou Malnati's Pizza, Uno's Pizza, etc... 2) "Most" reception personnel are nice and friendly... 3) Breakfast is good (Didn't care for the mass produced powdered eggs) 4) Decent fitness center Con's - 1) Prices are not that beneficial to AAA or Government travelers... 2) Rooms are not conducive to anything longer than a two day stay for two people with luggage. I asked for a larger room, for $20 extra per night, with only extra hallway space (No extra livable space)(Very limited clothing storage space)... 3) Parking in the attached garage is $38 for hotel residents, but there's a $28 garage around the corner at Kinzie and Clark streets (next to CVS Drugstore) (If you stay in the attached hotel, you "CANNOT" get a luggage cart from the hotel and take it back to your vehicle.... You "MUST" have the concierge/bellhop retrieve your luggage with a luggage cart OVERALL: The hotel is a great stay so long as you get a great deal on the price (do your homework), stay in the $28 garage around the corner, and travel very light

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave12345
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights whilst visiting Chicago. The hotel is easily accesible from midway airport and close to the shops etc (if you don't want the 10 minute walk there are regular busses running from outside the hotel or it's just a couple of minutes walk to the subway station or there are always taxis going past). All the staff here were friendly and helpful, the room was clean and comfortable. To avoid noise from the street we requested a high floor and didn't get disturbed at all. We did not use the pool but it looked clean. Internet access is provided for free in the rooms and there are computers in the lobby if you don't have a laptop. I guess my only negative point would be that breakfast is only served until 9am during the week which meant that after a night in a bar we did not always make it down in time. Other than that we had a really enjoyable stay in Chicago and would stay here again if we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Small suite, but great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeBrutus
Reviews.Content: The only thing I didn't expect from this hotel was the size of the room. Usually a suite has quite a bit more space than this, but this room looks like it used to be a standard room and a suite's furniture/accommodations were shoe-horned into it. See the little sketch I did of the floor plan in my pictures... when the sleeper sofa was out you could barely get around the room. For the four of us with luggage and shopping packages it was a bit of a pain. Otherwise the hotel was great... very clean, friendly staff, decent breakfast, great location, and a fair price. The steep parking fees are ugly, but you can reduce these by $10/night by self parking... the valet/bellman at the door told us all about it and how to do it so it wasn't a hassle at all. Would definitely stay here again if it's just the wife and I, or get two rooms if the kids come along.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: sunsetd
Reviews.Content: We did not have a good start as we requested early check-in which unfortunately was not granted, however as they told us that our room would be ready around 5pm (check-in is 3pm) we were quite 'astounded'. We did not expect that as we wanted to join the Magnificent Mile Lights Festival at 5pm. The hotel was kind enough to stow our luggage away safely and managed to have us check-in at 3pm. We'd like to mention that staff was always very kind, supportive and very attentive (check-in desk, housekeeping as well as staff in charge of breakfast lounge). Our suite was on the 21st floor and a little bit small, elevators can only be used with room key cards so there were no unbidden guests. Apart from many reviews we were not bothered by the fire department in the line of duty which was one block away. The location of the hotel is amazing, five minute walk to the loop, the EL and North Michigan Avenue, very close to many wonderful restaurants (Harry Caray's is just across the street). Taxis were out front whenever you needed them. It was very convenient. We even checked out the pool on 27th floor (shared with the Residence Inn) which is rather small and the so-called spa is a hot tub but it was nice, clean and at sunrise you have a wonderful view over the gold coast. Continental breakfast was complimentary and very good, they had a wide choice and staff made sure there was always enough on the plate. Housekeeping changed towels every day (although we did not ask for it), so there was nothing to complain about. We had an extraordinary stay and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BigBouncingBear
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Full Service Marriott almost across the way from this hotel. Well for now on I will be staying at the Springhil. More room, more amenities, and less money. The room was a lot nicer than any of the other hotels I have stayed in while in Chicago. I highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a better family hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: RDSConcord
Reviews.Content: I brought my two little girls (and wife) to Chicago to cheer me on for the marathon. The SpringHill Suites was awesome....just under a mile from the start of the race, and right in the thick of things in downtown. The staff was incredibly pleasant and professional, I met many other runners there with kids, and the room was contemporary and well-furnished (we got a suite). There is a pool on one of the top floors, but it was noisy for those not used to screaming kids (not mine, I swear). We really loved this little sanctuary and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “I was very disappointed by the hidden charges which are not disclosed until check in time.”
Reviews.Author: selfjenniferl
Reviews.Content: I expect occupancy and room taxes; however, this hotel charges > $26.00 in taxes. The room rate of $173/night is most misleading. The most annoying charge is the $50.00 PER NIGHT "incidental fee" in case of damages or other charges. Even more vexing is the fact that it takes so long for this fee to be reimbursed to one's card. The front desk staff explains it as a "hold" that will be reimbursed to the card. It doesn't matter what it's called - the money is still not available until such time as the charge is reversed. If the stay is three nights, that's an additional $150.00 charge for the privilege of occupying that hotel. As someone who makes my own bed, hangs up my towels, produces little in the way of garbage and only goes to the hotel room to sleep, I find this charge unacceptable and intrusive and borderline insulting. I'll probably avoid Marriott properties as much as possible in the future. Additionally, the ATM machine was out of service for the entire visit. The closest ATM was somewhere down the block.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location!”
Reviews.Author: tlm3
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel! Check in was a breeze, room was perfect, breakfast was much more than you would ever expect and you can not beat the location. Close enough to everything, without being in the middle of it. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cmanrique23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent for groups. I stayed here with my high school students' senior field trip. The hotel did a great job accommadating our group needs. There were lots of families and other groups staying at this hotel. Everyone was friendly, from the custiodial staff and the "breakfast ladies" to the front desk and group sales. Requests were promptly excuted and directions to area attractions were readily available, especially using thier public transportation. The location is great. Lots of night life and restaurants. Its just 5 minutes from an "L" station. Would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good for families”
Reviews.Author: JRLCW
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend here for a large family reunion. We're a family of four, our two kids are 14 and 11. On the plus side: the hotel location is great, right in midst of downtown Chicago, plenty of sights, shops, and restaurants just a short walk away. Very kid-friendly, with a Wii hookup and free computer access in the lobby. Lots of common space/seating area in the lobby, which of course, was perfect for family-reunion type gatherings and relaxing. Breakfast buffet was included -- the food isn't anything to write home about, but not something to complain about either. On the "less plus" side: our room was small for the four of us -- two double beds and a sofabed, which was tight even with the sofabed closed. On our first attempt at opening the sofabed, there wasn't enough room to open it all the way, since it bumped into the desk and the desk was attached to the wall and couldn't be moved. We eventually had to rearrange the furniture to reposition the sofabed so that it could be used. Long story short, it made for cramped quarters. Now, we didn't spend much time in the room anyway, but it's sort of a pain in the neck to try and make your way around a weirdly positioned sofabed in the middle of the night on the way to the bathroom. Both the gym and the pool are small, so if that's important to you, you might consider other options. Despite my complaints about the room, we had a wonderful time in Chicago and the location of the hotel and the common lobby areas made for a nice family gathering

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel close to sights, shopping, restaurants and transportation”
Reviews.Author: girlluxe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over Thanksgiving for 2 nights. The rate was $89, which was low compared to other comparable hotels I saw when booking online. I was highly satisfied with the amenities and convenience of this hotel. I previously lived in Chicago for a long time, so I knew what to look for in a hotel location. It is only a couple blocks from the el, and even closer to the bus stop. There are so many good restaurants and shops nearby. The lobby are rooms are pleasantly decorated. The staff was very helpful and had handouts available at the front desk with information on attractions and recommended restaurants. The included breakfast was abundant and convenient. It was so nice to have a refrigerator and microwave in the room. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: 1tiredpuppy
Reviews.Content: This was a girlfriends trip September 7-9 and we had a wonderful time! This is my new favorite place to stay in Chicago. It is so close to everything. The Red line, shopping and great places to eat. The staff is some of the best I have ever seen. From the front desk to the doorman, everyone was so nice and really seemed to enjoy their jobs. The rooms were very clean, modern and the beds were so comfortable. We had no noise problem on the 20th floor. We enjoyed the breakfast and found the selection to be really nice. The lobby areas are large and clean and we enjoyed just sitting around, having some of the free coffee or tea and reading the paper. Thanks Marriott for a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Party of 6 happy with Springhill Suites”
Reviews.Author: NYCforMe
Reviews.Content: My group of 6 friends/co-workers stayed at Springhill Suites River North for 3 nights, and we were very pleased with this hotel. We had booked 2 rooms with 2 double beds each through an Expedia package deal, and we were given 2 adjoining rooms with a door in between, which was great for us. I don't know that I've ever seen a hotel with such helpful and happy staff; everyone from the check-in to the breakfast room workers and the housekeeping staff were extremely nice and it seemed that they really liked working there. The rooms are small for suites, but we didn't spend a lot of time in the room anyway, so it didn't really matter. We didn't have any of the noise issues mentioned in other reviews, and in fact, it was very quiet. The free breakfast was quite good and included pre-made omelets and sausage, waffles, cereals, bagels, yogurt, milk, juices, etc. You could also go to the Residence Inn breakfast that was in the lobby right next to Springhill Suites, but the food was basically the same except for the addition of breakfast potatoes. Veronica in the Springhill Suites breakfast room was especially sweet and a friendly face in the morning. The location is great - you can walk to the Magnificent Mile and the Loop from the hotel, and it is also close to bus stops and El stations. My only complaint would be the air conditioning system, which runs constantly and blows right in your face if you're sleeping in the bed closest to the vent. It took some creative fort-making with the pillows to try to solve this problem, but again, no big deal. It certainly wouldn't stop me from staying at this hotel again. My entire group was pleased with the choice of this hotel, and we would all recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Londinium
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the station â€œGrandâ€� on the Red line. The room is very large with 2 double beds, 1 working desk, a microwave, a fridge a bathroom with shower with a sink outside, and there is a large flat screen TV. The hotel has a swimming pool (very small and it smells chlorate from the beginning of the lobby so we did not use it) and there is also a laundry on 27th floor which is convenient. The breakfast room is quite big but unfortunately the choice is not large. The staff is very friendly and helpful, much better than in other hotels. There is a Whole Food Market store only 7 streets away from the hotel (Huron Street) where you can find nice and tasty food. There is also a small â€œMarketâ€� near the reception desk where you an buy some drinks and food in case you would arrive late and be hungry. The doors of the rooms slam and are really noisy, thatâ€™s the only negative point I have for this hotel. (but you may be lucky and have neighbours who care when coming back late or leaving early, that was not the case at our floor â€¦). The hotel offers free wired and wifi internet.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in an excellent location in the city”
Reviews.Author: bretts11
Reviews.Content: My most recent stay at this Springhill was with several friends for a night out at the Chicago bars. I've also stayed here in the past with family and also alone for business trips. I've always found the hotel to be clean and the staff to be of very high quality for a Springhill. The parking garage attached to the hotel is not owned by the hotel, but you receive a daily discounted rate of $38 when using it for your stay. I wouldn't recommend valet parking here since the self-park garage is attached to the hotel. It's not worth the extra fee. The breakfast is above average for Springhill's also and much higher than the standard hotel fare. It is self-serve, but set up almost like a restaurant. The location is on Dearborn street just north of the Chicago River. The "River North" neighborhood is full of quality restaurants and bars, and the hotel is within walking distance to Michigan Avenue as well. The hotel is also within an easy walk to the red line train to get to Wriglely or U.S. Cellular Field within 15 minutes. The brown line is also a relatively easy walk in the opposite direction. I was most pleased with this hotel when I was able to book a two-queen room, with a pull out sofa as well. We were able to accomdate about 10 guys within the 3-bed hotel room. The internet provided in the business center is free and quick. The pool and fitness center are located on the top floor (27th floor), amazing views from up there.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable noise levels”
Reviews.Author: Docray1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is relatively new. It is a few blocks from Michigan Ave but is located right next to a Fire Station and above a bar that had a live band when we were there. It seemed as though the windows were open until 3am as the sirens and thumping from the band were terrible. The staff's efforts to move us to another room were of limited value; noone in our party slept while we were there. We also had to spend an inordinate amount of time trying to get some satisfaction from the manager and staff; their efforts were far less than we would have hoped for. If location and quality of sleep are a priority, there are many, many better choices in downtown Chicago. I would avoid this hotel if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for city attractions”
Reviews.Author: elsie44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here July 6 - 9 with four children ages 11 - 15. Great location near public transportation. Clean room, plentiful breakfast, nice pool area. Very secure facility. Only negative was the air conditioning did not cool the room as much as we would have liked but temps were extreme that week.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful new, clean hotel, great staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: ILTJ
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Chicago with my husband, my sister and brother-in-law. We had originally booked a double suite but due to it being Memorial Day weekend and President Obama was in town(the secret service and Air Force One crew were staying at the hotel), they emailed(personally by the manager of the hotel) us weeks in advance to advise us they didn't have a double bed and we were upgraded to a corner king. At first we weren't thrilled as two of us would have to sleep on the sleeper sofa, but they included our parking so we decided that we would manage. The manager spoke and emailed me directly- not just any customer service representative- which I loved. The corner king was awesome! The views were amazing- we had windows facing the lake and north. The room was big and the sofa sleeper was comfortable- you couldn't feel the middle bar at all! Wifi throughout the hotel for free, computers in the lobby for your use, breakfast was good- waffles, pastries, oatmeal, cereal, sausage and egg patties to make sandwiches, and they also have a wii in the lobby if you want to play. Parking garage is attached to the hotel so the self parking was a breeze. Close to the river and Michigan Ave. We ate mostly at Frontera and Topolobampo so it was super close for us to go eat. There are lots of restaurants and many little bars right around the corner. The only part of the hotel that I didn't really like were the elevators- you have to go up to the 2nd floor lobby and then get on other elevators to the floors and you have to have your room key to access the floors- good for security but my room card would never work in the elevator for some reason. The pool and hot tub are nice- great views but they had a terrace patio but it was locked and I don't think they ever unlock it- not sure why. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for family visit”
Reviews.Author: outandaround
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, friendly staff, and great location. We were able to walk to the Loop, and from the 25th floor, the view was great! We were in 2 rooms- my 5 person family in a double suite (which included a sofa bed), and my mother in a king suite. The rooms were not very large. My mother had more than enough room. Our room was a little cramped- there was room for all of us, but we couldn't spread out. If room size is important to you, and you have more than 3 or 4 people in your party, get two rooms. I should point out, though, that being able to put 5 people into a suite made this hotel a great value for a downtown hotel. The breakfast was was definitely middle of the road- belgian wafflemaker, mini-boxes of cereal, bagels, toast, some egg dish, etc-quite adequate, but nothing exciting- but we did get a song from Veronica at the end of our breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money - Clean Hotel & Room”
Reviews.Author: Sonu78
Reviews.Content: I was well received at the reception and allowed an early check in and a late check out, unusual of hotels. The room was spacious and had a panoramic view from 22nd Floor. The breakfast is complimentary and serves variety of food. There is a Wii besides the reception and can be used any of the guests. I use them during my free time at hotel. The location of the hotel is great and lot of good restraunt are nearby. The hotel has a well equiped gym and a nice swimming pool. I would recommend it to all business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great in every way”
Reviews.Author: sarge94061
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel after tearing my hair out trying to find a reasonably priced nice hotel in a central Chicago location. I only had the one full day in Chicago for sightseeing and as such wanted to be right in the middle of things. I was only 5 minutes from the nearest El station and about 10 minutes walk from the loop, so it was ideal. Springhill Suites were excellent in every way. The front desk staff were really friendly and helpful (pointed me in the direction of the best deep dish pizza I've ever had - Lou Malnatis'). The corner suite I had on the 18th floor was huge and the views excellent. I suspect this is primarily used by business travellers however I would have no hesitation in recommending it for leisure travellers as well.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly confortable in good location”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTommy
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights early May 2010 after conference at other hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful, hotel had a good vibe and felt secure and funny enough intimate. It has a great guest laundry. Location was good, bit better than expected as it is a few blocks to Michigan Ave. Get there through the back of Nordstrom. Lots of restaurants and convenience stores close. Clean, comfortable bed, good facilites in room, free internet. Breakfast setup good, staff nice, friendly and helpful again. Varied guests and a few families as you would expect. Springhill Suites Chicago keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect room to enjoy the city”
Reviews.Author: KikiTee
Reviews.Content: Others have said it, this is in a fantastic location. It's about 3 blocks to the mile for shopping, restaurants and bars are closer. Harry Caray's had fantastic food with fun waiters, just on the corner. And Howl at the Moon is a GREAT bar, we had a blast there. One thing about ALL Marriott branded hotels I've stayed at is their service. Everyone in the hotel seems happy to be working there, I've been to lots of hotels where that isn't the case and the service suffers. At Marriott you never feel like you're wasting their time. The hotel itself. Residence Inn and Springhill share the same building. Normally I stay at Residence but it wasn't available. The SH rooms are quite a bit smaller, and they face away from the lake, so even on a high floor the views aren't spectacular. But they were more than adequate. The pullout was comfortable. Lots of storage. Somebody had mentioned the firehall. It is quite close, and you do hear a lot of sirens, but noise pollution in Chicago is extreme anyway. We laughed and noticed it quite a bit at first, but quickly got used to it. Breakfast was good we did the Residence breakfast and the Springhill, and they were the same, the one on the Residence side was a little more spacious, they served the same food. No bacon, and very little fruit on either side, which was disappointing. Wifi was easy to use and the lobby even has a wii, so, no kids running around underfoot! The 27th floor pool was tiny, but with gorgeous views. Gym was quite large, as was the laundry room. There was a patio, but it was always locked. Elevators were confusing, as they weren't labeled for which hotel you were going to. Make sure you get back on the one you got off! All in all, a fantastic trip. I think next time, I'd try to stay at the Residence, just because the rooms are bigger. But I wouldn't complain if Springhill was the only thing available. TIP: If you are going out at night. Everywhere charges cover. Ask the front desk if they have any passes to the nearby bars, we saved $15 at Howl at the Moon. Most of the nearby bars give them to get you in. We saw at least 3 bars drop some off. Cabfare to Union Station was about $10. Much less hassle than walking to the El, which we did on the way there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great breakfast, Great room, Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Andre S
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel without reservation - it's conveniently located for bus, train, and just plain ol' walking. It provides a great room with a comfortable pullout couch seating area, nicely appointed bathrooms, very clean, comfortable bed, a terrific breakfast is included in the morning, and every staff member is begging to be nice to you and help in any way possible. No complaints whatsoever! Great stay at a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrazone
Reviews.Content: This is really a great hotel in a great location. Thre rooms are comfortable, neat, and clean. The location is great - easy walking to many restaurants - Ruth's Chris right across the street is a great plus! The rooms are on the smaller side, but that is typical for any hotel in a major city. The free breakfast in the morning is nice. Next time I go to Chicago would certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, surprisingly affordable for downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ejdb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip to Chicago for 5 nights in Feb. 2010. I was really surprised how nice this hotel was. I used to live in Chicago, so I was really familiar with the area, but if you aren't that familiar with the location it may seem a tiny bit off the beaten path (since it isn't right on Michigan Avenue - but only a few blocks away). Service was excellent and the desk staff were very friendly. The room (a corner king suite) was enormous for a major city hotel room, and also clean and comfortable. You can walk to transportation, restaurants, the Art Institute, Millennium Park, etc. There is also free breakfast daily, which was good and included hot things like eggs and waffles. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Wascooper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River North Springhill Suites Feb 4-7 and had a wonderful experience! The staff was very accommodating with our requests and were very friendly. This location is perfect for a weekend getaway. We were able to walk from the train that brought us in from the airport and we walked everywhere we needed to go. Location is close to good restaurants and bars, not far from Michigan Ave shopping, and a 10 minute walk to the theatre district. The room size was fine and we had a view of both the Tribune and the Wrigley buidlings. Bonus: free Wi Fi! We never needed a map because we could always pull up Google Maps on my IPod and plan our day. We would stay at the Springhill Suites every time we come to Chicago...I have nothing bad to say about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: aussie_traveler_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights while sightseeing in Chicago. The hotels location is wonderful, walking distance to all the attractions. The double queen room on the 26th floor was very spacious, clean and tidy. We did have the free breakfast in the Springhill suites on the first morning, but then we decided to have breakfast in the Residence inn. Nicer setup with a few more offerings. There is a car park right behind the hotel which will set you back a cool $34 per night self park, no in/out privileges. We found the staff to be extremely helpful, and very fast to respond to our needs. Yes will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “What a deal!”
Reviews.Author: Buferson
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here on a Sunday night for $79 for a king suite. It's new, clean and in a great location. We walked to the Christmas Mart, Mag Mile and along the river. The room isn't huge, but was big enough for us and adult daughter. The front desk staff was incredibly friendly. We enjoyed chatting with them any time we passed through the lobby. Breakfast was good, not out of the ordinary. Again the staff in the beakfast was friendly. We parked around the corner at Sterling Self-Park for $28 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....except for one small thing....”
Reviews.Author: wishiwasindestin
Reviews.Content: I'm not blowing this out of proportion. There is a fire station a block north of the hotel and it is quite active. It seemed like there was a call at least every hour, usually southbound particularly on Saturday, even at night. Our corner room on the 22nd floor sounded like those fire trucks were coming thru the hotel. Noise from the interior of the hotel was minimal, but from outside, well I guess that's why they call it the big city, but this was our third trip to Chicago in the last 3 years, with 2 stays previous at the Hilton GI. I don't remember it being that loud there. The room was modern and spacious, everything was new and clean. Check in was great, they let us in at 12:30 pm, the staff helpful and attentive, although we had to call for maid service on Sunday after 3pm. Breakfast was OK at best. Some of the pastries and bagels we had seemed past day old. Based on our experience, I think I would pass on this hotel if the opportunity to stay here again ever arose.

Reviews.Title: “Definite Return Trip to this One!”
Reviews.Author: FlyCat
Reviews.Content: This was a really terrific hotel that I will definitely frequent again. My husband & I come to Chicago every year at Thanksgiving for my birthday so we have stayed in many places over the years - Hampton, Monaco, Hotel 71, Hilton Garden Inn, Wyndham, Four Points Sheraton, etc. Knowing my way around Chicago, I chose to try the Springhill Suites on Dearborn and am I glad I did! Although the location is great, just a couple of blocks off Michigan & State, it's actually easy to miss the hotel - the signage outside is quite plain and it shares an entrance w/ Residence Inn. The actual lobby for both chains is on the 2nd floor. Check-in was great, staff very accommodating -- I even got a bottle of wine for my birthday. The elevators are the fastest and smoothest of any hotel I've ever stayed in. The hotel offers a nice hot/cold complimentary breakfast as well - a bit early for a "leisure" trip (6:30-9:00 a.m.). We had a "studio" double room. It was perfect, very chic and modern. Sitting area had a desk, chaise, and sleeper couch and was separated from bedroom area by frosted glass. Plenty of lighting (which is a big complaint w/ me because most rooms are just too dark). We had a microwave, frig, and coffee maker. Bath area was good size and vanity area was separate w/ plenty of top space to put items. The only issue I had was the lack of good sized drawers for clothes that you didn't want to hang .. there were only (2) very shallow drawers. I would rate this hotel as EXCELLENT.

Reviews.Title: “Good base to explore central Chicago”
Reviews.Author: rugbygeezer
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel, for its location and because we have a Marriott loyalty card. The check in was easy, we were offered a choice of rooms. The twin room was nicely laid out, with views towards the south. The breakfast was a standard buffet style offering that is normal for this class of hotel in the US. Although we did not use all of the facilities we did look at the pool and exercise facilities and they looked adequate although the pool was a little small. We were able to walk easily to the river, the magnificent mile and also to down town. It is ideally located for the Ruth's Chris Steakhouse which is a definite bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Highly Reccommended”
Reviews.Author: Filmgal
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here in October 2009, and the hotel was all around fantastic. The King Suite was exactly as the pictures showed online. Lots of room for 3 adults to share, clean, with great amenities in the room including a powerful hairdryer, iron and full-size ironing board, microwave, and fridge. King size bed and pull-out couch very comforatble. 24 hour store located at recption, as well as a lounge. Friendly and helpful staff allowed for early morning check-in without requesting it in advance and bag storage after hotel check-out. The breakfast buffet was excellent with both hot and cold options including eggs, sausage, waffles, fruits and cereal, as well as a coffee/tea station. Free internet/printer in the lobby was hardly ever in use. Friendly door staff give excellent directions and hail cabs quickly. The location of the hotel is the best feature as it is within walking distance to major sites and several metro stops. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal for a Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: awoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Springhill Suites over Labor Day weekend with our teenage sons. The hotel met our every need. The rooms were a little on the small side for a suite but you can't beat it for the price. Location was excellent, just a short walk to Michigan Ave. The free internet access in the lobby was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate Hotel, Ideal Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: luvpigeonforge
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Springhill Suites/River North two weeks ago and are still missing it! We arrived two hours before check-in and had no problems with early check-in (including our extra requests). Immediately, the staff went to work suggesting restaurants nearby and travel directions. The room itself was big enough to allow three people to breathe. They're not as big as the suites at Embassy and have a partition (as opposed to a divided wall). Still, the room was very nice, clean and comfortable. I can't emphasize how secure this hotel makes you feel. It has just over 200 rooms and it's not so big that it has to be impersonal. Instead, it's quiet and beautiful. The location is ideal as you're within a few blocks of ESPN Zone, Hard Rock Cafe, House of Blues . . . and most important, Michigan Ave. We always felt safe in and around the hotel. Finally, the breakfast area was great. The food was good and has one of the best employees (Veronica) that you'll ever meet! Can't say enough good about this hotel, highly recommend it and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Springhill Suites”
Reviews.Author: ekwcoyote
Reviews.Content: Stayed with spouse and 2 teenage girls last Saturday night. It was our second time staying at this hotel and was just as good of an experience as the first time. The rooms are so quiet and comfortable. We loved having the extra sleeping area with the hideabed. The pool and jacuzzi were great and open until 11 PM. Continental breakfast was well stocked with a great selection. Staff was extremely accomodating and friendly. Parking was steep at $44, but I guess that is par for the course downtown. Easily walked 4 blocks to the shopping on Michigan Ave. We will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in downtown Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Trish0928
Reviews.Content: I'd stayed at the Residence Inn on the other side of the building last year, so when my husband and I were planning our Chicago trip we decided on SpringHill Suites because it was a bit cheaper. The location absolutely can't be beat--a five-minute walk to the Grand/State Street station on the Red Line subway (as an FYI the station is undergoing renovation but it's still open), a couple of minutes more to the Magnificent Mile, tons of shops and restaurants. We got there very early (10 a.m.) but a suite was available. We splurged for a corner suite which had a great view of the Tribune and Wrigley buildings with Lake Michigan in the background. The suite was pretty spacious with a comfortable bed, a flat-screen TV, and a sink/fridge area, although the fridge is more like a beverage cooler. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful, always greeting us with a smile whether it was the front desk person or a housekeeper. The fitness room is very well-equipped and the laundry room came in very handy. The hotel does have a convenience store but there's a Jewel/Osco supermarket right near the El station where you can pick up drinks and snacks much cheaper. For the price you simply can't do better than SpringHill!

Reviews.Title: “Quick, but fantastic Chicago trip”
Reviews.Author: andie-kom
Reviews.Content: We arrived about 3 hours earlier than check-in to the Springhill Suites, which didn't seem to be a problem at all. Every employee we saw was friendly and welcoming. The giant bowl of lollipops at the front desk was a bonus. We had a 4th floor handicapped room (it was the only one ready due to our early arrival). Although the handicapped room was smaller than a typical suite there, it was very comfortable and the restroom was huge. Our group of 4 twenty-somethings had no complaints about the space in our room. And the mini-fridge and microwave were so handy to have. Also, the wireless internet was free and worked wonderfully. The hotel is in an excellent location. Quick walks to shopping and amazing dining. And just steps from the dueling piano bar Howl at the Moon (which is a must-do for tourists!). A couple other great things about the Springhill Suites- the amazing free breakfast (it was delicious, had tons of variety and the employees were so friendly and quick to help with anything) and the pool and hot tub (although the pool is kind of small, it was rarely crowded, the view is amazing and a soak in the hot tub really hit the spot after a day of shopping and sightseeing). I would return to this hotel in a minute. I have zero complaints and our group can't stop talking about going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Family of 5 visits Chicago”
Reviews.Author: digitaljake
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Up to all of Marriott hotel standards (what I really like about Marriott -- consistency). It is connected to another Marriott hotel. They have free breakfast, and the other hotel (can't remember name) had better food -- which you can easily walk over to. They share same elevators and pool, but have different lobbies (connected though). The rooms are small. But typical for a city room. Our 2 younger kids shared a double bed. My husband and myself had the other double, and our 12 year old had the pull out sofa bed. Room had a decent view. Windows open to outside. Had a refrigerator too. Great location. Lots of stuff close by. Walked to Rainforest Cafe restaurant. Parking is expensive though, and across the street about a block away. Can only valet park. So, we had to take a lot out of the car, since it would be difficult to go back to it. Used AAA discount, and received at good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: kysdisease1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a King room on the 4th floor. It was still a nice view with floor to ceiling windows. The bottom part of the windows allow you to open them up a bit which is a nice feature. Bed was very comfortable, we both slept like babies. There is a partial wall that separates the living room from the bedroom area. There is one television that swivels to whichever area you are in. Also a small area with a microwave, small refrigerator, and sink. The bathroom sink is outside of the bathroom which is convenient for one person using the vanity while the other is showering. Everything was new, this hotel must have been built within the past year or two. The complimentary breakfast was nice. Not only do they offer muffins, yogurt and fruit but eggs, waffles, and sausage, as well â€“ IMO a little better than your standard continental breakfast. The hotel staff was pleasant and helpful. Our original plan was to only stay here for one night but, we ended up staying another night. The hotel extended the same rate to us as the previous night. Great location, within walking distance to many restaurants and about 2 blocks North of the river. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “New, New, Bland”
Reviews.Author: Brian Thomas
Reviews.Content: Hotel is paired with a Marriott Residence Inn (shared lobbies). Big pleasant public areas. Nice room with small kitchen area, flat screen tv, all new. Free no frills breakfast. Great location. Good value for business, nice views.

Reviews.Title: “Another good hotel in River North”
Reviews.Author: anono99
Reviews.Content: We go to Chicago quite often, and recently stayed here for 2 nights as the place we normally stay was all booked up. Now we have another good option in the River North area. The rooms were spacious, and the decor was a little more modern. I liked the layout of the room a lot. We were on the 22nd floor and had a nice view of the city from the floor to ceiling window. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great breakfast and practical location.”
Reviews.Author: TravelDavidEtAl
Reviews.Content: Our family, (my wife and I and our two daughters, 15 & 18), stayed here for a 4-day-getaway in the city. The room worked very well for us, although three relatively simple changes would have made it that much better: queen beds instead of doubles; a second sink next to the frig/micro/coffee maker; reading lights for each bed and another for the sofa. Our nightly rate, $129, included a very nice breakfast each morning in the large, very comfortable dining area. Hot and cold selections, including fresh fruit, cereals, eggs, etc. The breakfast staff was extremely efficient, helpful and friendly. And, to say the least, the same can be said of all the rest of the hotel staff that we encountered! For our needs, the location worked well. We could walk or easily taxi to all of the destinations we'd planned on visiting -- as well as a couple we hadn't planned on. The one negative -- which is certainly not unique to this hotel or location -- is parking, specifically the cost of parking. Hotel valet parking was $44/day; surface parking several blocks away was $33, and several public ramps within 4-6 blocks was $37. In any case, we really enjoyed our stay at the Springhill Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, very good location”
Reviews.Author: pbark
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this location on a weekend trip to Chicago. Right in the heart of downtown near several restaurants, House of Blues, Ruth's Chris, etc. The rooms were very nice with a small minibar with microwave and small fridge. The breakfast was pretty decent and a plus if you don't want to venture out of the hotel for a morning meal. Free wireless internet for guests. There is shopping nearby, you can catch a trolley to Navy Pier nearby and Michigan Ave is within walking distance. At night the neighborhood turns into a barhoppers/clubgoers dream. All the restaurants in the area pretty much turn into nightclubs so just be prepared for the change in scenery on weekends at night. We got a steal of a deal at $109 when Marriot.com was running a special. The only downside was $40 per night for parking which added $120 to our hotel bill. Other than that everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: HappyRower
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a "girls weekend" trip with my sisters and our two teenage girls. This hotel was great. Ideal location; we walked everywhere from this hotel. Extremely friendly, accommodating staff. Quiet with clean rooms. And the breakfast was definitely the best continental breakfast any of us has ever had included in a hotel stay. We all agreed that we would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “chicago is Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: queen409
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was excellent, The breakfast in the morning was delicious. The variety was perfect. So much food to choose from. I love the rooms and the service was with a smile. I would go back again and again. Chicago is my kind of city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: wallywilbur
Reviews.Content: As a Marriott rewards member , received an alert a few weeks in advance about a rate deal at this property - jumped on it , probably save $90 per night it was a very nice property , clean , convenient to restaurants , subway , shopping , sightseeing it had an OK complimentary breakfast which I think is unusual for a downtown Chicago hotel , nice fitness center - everything worked

Reviews.Title: “great value, great service”
Reviews.Author: esemaan
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a trip to Chicago, this is the place. Friendly from the 1st minute we arrived. Location not to far from Michigan Street 5 minutes walk, but far from all the noise. Rooms are very clean, staff always smiling and asking you if you need any help. Breakfast exceeds any continental breakfast I have seen. 5 stars all the way. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value, great service, new construction.”
Reviews.Author: snyd3202
Reviews.Content: This hotel (and the adjoining Marriott Residence Inn) were built in 2008 and are still new and in wonderful shape. We had very friendly service by every employee. Hotel offers free wi-fi and computers in the lobby with internet access and a printer for free. That is not at all common for downtown hotels in the area, and was a very nice perk. Overall a great, affordable stay in a convenient downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value in River North!”
Reviews.Author: djack8494
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at this all suite hotel. It was built in 2008, so everything is very modern and very clean. We experienced top notch service from the time we pulled up in front, until the time we left. The valet and bellboys were on their toes, greeting us and opening the hotel doors at the first sight of our approach. The front desk staff was very gracious, attentive, and helpful with all of our questions about the city, and patient with my 5 year old son who loves to have lengthy coversations with everybody. Breakfast is included, which was essential for our kids, but even my husband ate when he saw the make your own waffle stations. The only other hot foods were sausage and egg patties for making english muffin sandwiches. There were many continental breakfast items to choose from. We had a 2 double room, which was modern and clean, with a sitting area w/ sofa sleeper. I only wish it was a bit bigger. With the 2 kids we felt just a tiny bit cramped, but keeping our room tidy helped. Location was perfect, we walked to Michigan Ave and back, caught a free trolley to Navy Pier, and took a few $5 cab rides around the city. Parking at the hotel was a bit pricey at $44/day, but that allowed us unlimited in/out privleges. Excellent value for a downtown hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: awhipker
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at this hotel for my bachelor party and it was excellent. Being a bachelor party, we preferred to spend our money on things other than a hotel and no decent hotel could beat the price at Spring Hill Suites. I dont think there could be a better location for the hotel. It is on Dearborn Street just north of the River and within walking distance are some of Chicago's best attractions and restaurants (House of Blues, Dick's Last Resort, Portillos, Harry Carey's, Michigan Ave, etc.). If you are using public transportation to get into Chicago its 6 blocks from Millineium Station and 2 blocks from the "L" Blue Line. The room's are excellent. We had a 2 double suite with a fold out sectional couch. The rooms could be a little bigger, but we had 6 guys staying in the same room. On a side note, there are 2 hotels in this building and they share a common lobby; Spring Hill Suites on the left and Residence Inn on the right. This can become confusing if you have a had a little too much to drink and end up at the same room number but in the wrong hotel. The staff was excellent and will help you in anyway possible. The breakfast was fantasic and had just about everything you can think of. I will definately stay at this hotel again when I return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “I am ready to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Compleks
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel and Chicago in general to everyone. The service, the people, the food, the clean streets are all worth 5 stars!!

Reviews.Title: “It's all in the details”
Reviews.Author: bostock22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 2524 for four nights and were less than impressed. I get that the hotel isn't the Four Seasons, but there were some glaring details that were missing. The bad: 1)housekeeping was VERY stingy with coffee cups and drinking glasses. For a room with a "kitchenette" I would expect some kind of a supply of cups, paper even! Some of our glassware was dirty (sticky) 2) The flourescent light above the bed is horrendous and much too bright! 3) there is a bedside table on only one side of the king size bed 3) No bed stand lights 4) the light in the kitchenette is turned on by the switch around the corner in the hallway 4) even though the kitchenette has ample room to store plates etc, the plasticware and 2 plates were stored in the microwave.??? and there is no garbage can in the kitchenette! 5) there is very little room to store your clothes 6) only 5 clothes hangers (really) 7) we arrived at 4PM and were told our room wasn't ready (we waited about 15 min. until the front desk could contact housekeeping 8) Housekeeping is inconsiderate when cleaning the rooms, they were contstantly slamming the doors when going in and out of a room. 9) I got a dirty bath towel. Now for the good: 1)excellent location 2)good price 3)free bkfst (get there early) 4)free internet 5) great pool area

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Otoh
Reviews.Content: Room was large, comfortable, modern, and immaculate. Great location relative to "EL" and walking. Complementary interenet access a plus. Breakfast room is spacious. Good value. I'm hooked. Already booked my next return.

Reviews.Title: “Caution when using valet service,”
Reviews.Author: tentmaker
Reviews.Content: Spent a short wknd getaway at this location, unfortunately we valet parked our car and while in the parking garage someone broke into our vehicle and stole our gps, ipod, and other items that were stored out of sight. Hotel staff and valet service assured me that it would all be replaced, had me fill out a form and then mailed me a letter at home saying sorry we are not responsible for items left in vehicle...how nice of them. So, parkers beware!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Mundelein
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location and the price was right. Everyone from the reservations agent , the front desk staff, valet and the breakfast staff were extremely friendly and efficient. The room was spacious and clean. We arrived a day early for our reseravation and they were very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & modern, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: ant217
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for our first trip to Chicago. The location of the hotel is ideal for getting around the city, with plenty of local bars and restaurants, and the main shopping area just a short walk away. Red line tube stop is also a couple of blocks away. Staff are welcoming and friendly, and the room was ideal for us - a good size, with modern fittings and free wi-fi. The king size bed was comfortable, and it was nice to have that little more space than you normally get, as all the rooms are actually suites with a sofa area and sink/fridge/microwave. Good shower too. Breakfast was fine, although we did get a little bored of the same selection - not a problem if you are staying for a long weekend. At the price we paid, the fact that we had one at all was a bonus. Waffles were good, but they did seem to run low on fresh fruit during the mid week. We used the pool and hot tub and found both to be clean and very quiet during our time there. The pool isn't great if you are planning on swimming lengths (it's very small), but the gym is there too, so fitness fanatics should be fine. Our one small issue would be with the lifts, which use a really annoying access card system to prevent non-residents from getting onto floors. A good idea in principle, but more often than not, the cards just didn't seem to work first time. We were very happy with our stay overall, and would definitely recommend the hotel for anyone who wishes to visit the windy city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic bargain, enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: AThena53
Reviews.Content: My co-workers and I chose the Springhill Suites for a 4-night business stay and got an $89/night rate. The hotel appears brand new and the rooms are furnished in peaceful green and brown tones that gave them a very calm feel. I was given a corner suite with wonderful views of the city from floor-to-ceiling windows in both the bedroom and living room. I also had a microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker. High-speed Internet (included in room rate) was easy to use and dependable. Pool was on the small side; in the Fitness Center I occasionally had to wait for my preferred equipment but it was all state-of-the-art with individual video screens and iPod docks. Breakfast, also in room rate, included sausage, oatmeal and egg patties along with the usual cold selections- the menu was the same each day. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful; one had many restaurant recommendations, all down a street very close to the hotel. You can pretty much walk down that street and find a good variety of pub-type places as well as Brasserie Jo (very good French food). Ruth's Chris and Harry Caray's, both higher-end, also nearby. Plenty of retail in walking distance as well in case you forgot anything. One minor complaint was the elevators, which required the use of your room key before they worked. Sometimes you needed to insert the key multiple times, but eventually your floor button lit up. We were very impressed with this hotel and are likely to use it again next time we visit our Chicago office.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations in many ways”
Reviews.Author: TheNewEnglander
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful surprise this hotel was. I found it through Expedia and it seemed to have glowing reviews, but I was suspect what the downside might be as I had never been to the area or Chicago before. Getting to the hotel was reasonable from Grand station on the red line subway and was probably a 5-6 minute walk. The area itself is filled with late night hot spots and restaurants, though I feel the younger set (under 35) will be most pleased. The hotel entrance is unusual in that you walk into a lobby with elevators which you must take to a second lobby with the actual front desk. Odd, but possibly an advantage in some ways and keeps the check-in area free of chaos. The hotel service/staff is excellent. very friendly and helpful-although very young for the most part. They seem to try hard and smile whenever you cross their path. The rooms blew me away for value: very nicely appointed with a flat screen TV, king bed with different types of pillows, excellent shower with good hot water and pressure, and very clean. This site lists this as a 2 star hotel, but that's not possible, I'd say 3 at least given the room and decor. My favorite part of the room was that it was quiet-no street noise, no neighbor noise, no noise period (I was on the 19th floor I should point out). The breakfast buffet in the morning was nice as far as hotel buffets go. Some of the options included eggs, sausage, piping hot oatmeal, cereals, English muffins, white and wheat bread, juices, waffles, etc. It would be great if they added hash browns or potatoes-it would have felt complete. In summary: an excellent experience in a hotel that felt very new. I didn't have time to visit the pool or exercise room so I can't comment on it however. Tip: If you're a 20-something try Rockit for late night food and drinks (Warning-it's loud there upstairs) Rock Bottom brewery for craft beer or The House of Blues down the street and Hub 51 below the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, cute hotel, but rooms already showing some wear”
Reviews.Author: jengaworld
Reviews.Content: If only this hotel wasn't getting such heavy traffic. It's a very cute concept, with rooms similar to a Hyatt Place in design. We had a big king bed and really comfy seating area separated by a desk and frosted glass slidable window-like partition. Loved the wireless internet (also wired, both free); as well as the beverage chiller (like a mini fridge but not quite as cold) and the microwave. But the room lacked storage despite lots and lots of empty floor space in the sleeping area. Oddly our bedroom area was huge, while the sitting area was partitioned off in a small and cramped area next to the door. The hotel size swells 4x on weekends according to the desk clerk, and it shows. Weekend breakfast is mobbed and there aren't enough seats, although the attendants do a terrific job keeping the food stocked. And with groups of 4 and 5 crammed into rooms meant for just one or two, the hotel is showing a surprising amount of wear and tear for being so new. These rooms just weren't designed for heavy traffic, which is a shame because it's otherwise a nice place to stay. Our room had a nasty stain on the floor near the door, a lighter stain on the sectional couch, some peeling laminate on the microwave counter, and a hole in the desk chair's woven back from it hitting the edge of the desk. Weirdly, the hotel doesn't iron its linens (the front desk clerk said they "don't have a presser"), so the sheets, comforter and the decorative thingie on the foot of the bed were a wrinkled mess (not very reassuring to crawl into wrinkled sheets; we just crossed our fingers the linens had been changed since the last guest). The shower (no tub in our room) also didn't look super clean, but front desk assured us this is just a cosmetic problem from the laminating and that it's a problem in all the rooms. The upside: great location, super nice desk staff, free Wi-Fi, and it's sort of sweet to see kids in pajamas at the weekend breakfast, which lent a friendly family feel. But it would be nice to see the rooms better maintained -- and maybe some limits on the number of people the hotel allows in one room, especially since it shares space with the Residence Inn, which is really better suited for quad and quint parties sharing one room. We wold stay here again but it would be nice to see the wear issues addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great River North Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CaniacRN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at SpringHill Suites during a weekend getaway to Chicago. We hadn't been to Chicago before, so we weren't sure where the best location was, but this was awesome! Very convenient - a short (5 min or less) walk to the Grand - Red line station and the Clark/Lake station on the loop. Harry Caray's and House of Blues were across the street. Lots and lots of restaurants and bars around the hotel. The room was very comfortable. We had a studio King suite, and even though it was one room, the sitting area was separated from the sleeping area well. Not great view, but you could see the Merchandise Mart and other buildings from our room and out to the suburbs. Much better than other views I've had in other cities! Everything was clean and new. Microwave, small fridge, and coffee maker in the room was nice. Complimentary breakfast was great! We've stayed at nicer hotels that "included" breakfast of cold breads and cereal. SpringHill Suites breakfast had sausage patties, eggs, lots of breads, hot oatmeal, waffles, yogurts, fresh fruit (though it didn't look great - I'm picky though!), and cereals. Very good and a nice breakfast room! Everyone we encountered was so nice! The valets were always opening doors for us and offering to get a cab for us. We never felt unsafe around the hotel (or anywhere in Chicago really!).

Reviews.Title: “Another pleasant stay at Springhill”
Reviews.Author: caseys
Reviews.Content: Our family of four just returned from a one night stay at this hotel. I also stayed at this hotel in Sept. for a girls weekend. Both visits were very pleasurable. - This is a new hotel, so everything is in good working order and still clean. No mold in the showers, carpets still clean etc. - Beds are very comfortable and they give you plenty of pillows. (However, when I stayed here in Sept., I slept on the sofa bed and I found that to be really uncomfortable, so get a bed if you can.) -The breakfast is good, nice selection and quality is good. - The employees are very courteous and helpful. - Fitness room and pool were very nice, although the pool was a little chilly. - The location is great, within walking distance of the theater district, shopping and a lot of great restaurants. I would definitely recommend this hotel and we will be back ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Q
Reviews.Content: Spent a girls getaway weekend here. I'm a native Chicagoan and thought that this hotel was in a great location (restaurants, bars, etc.) The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The bed was very comfortable and the towels were plentiful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Windy City.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: dancin2x2
Reviews.Content: What a great place. We checked in early and valet took charge of our bags; directed us to an elevator to the main lobby and the registration desk; required room key to take separate elevator to the room - felt very secure. All hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Continental breakfast was definitely adequate - beats $$$ at a restaurant! Very close to most attractions. Left car in valet parking and took a cab or bus. Really easy to get around town with help from the great staff. The room was awesome. We were there during off'-season and got an exceptioinal rate. Enjoyed the pool/hot tub area at night overlooking the beautiful city. We will definitely come back and thanks for such a great place in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great River North Value”
Reviews.Author: rjc260
Reviews.Content: This newer property is a great value for downtown Chicago. This hotel has large rooms with modern furnishings (even if the color scheme is not my favorite) and comfortable beds. Given the low weekend rates the hotel was very crowded with families and tourists, but the noise level wasn't excessive. There is a lounge and snack bar in the lobby and a seating area for breakfast (simple but free). On the top floor there is a very nice pool and exercise room with high quality equipment and great views of the city. The layout is typical of a Marrriott SpringHill Suite but I felt this property offered a great value with no noticable flaws.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: ukiebabe1
Reviews.Content: A couple of girlfriends and I decided that we needed a girls weekend out in the city to get away from drama and life! We ended up at the Springhill Suites! Our room was big and very nice! We loved the view. The bellmen were very helpful and the front desk staff was very nice! Everything about the property was just amazing! Anytime we walked in or out we always got aknowleged and that just felt very nice and welcoming!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: clb78
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous! My husband and I took our 4 kids to Chicago for the Winter WonderFest and we could not have found better accommodations. The complimentary breakfast was a huge help in savings as there were 6 of us to feed. And they had cold as well as hot items to choose from. The pool was a huge hit with the kids. The workout room was very nice even though we did not have time to take advantage of it. The staff were the extremely kind and accommodating... anything we needed they were right on top of it meeting our needs. We can't wait until our next trip to the Windy City so we can book another stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wicked weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: Claven123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend Wicked trip and our Christmas vacation. A wonderful and nice hotel. I would stay here again and would recommend it to others. You are close to Michigan Ave, a roundabout walk to get there. You canâ€™t walk directly east to get there. A couple of blocks from Ohio and Ontario streets where all the eateries are located, Hard Rock, Gino's, Rain Forest, McDonalds etc... you can read some of the other reviews about the location to food. However, there is no room service, but you can have things delivered. No onsite place to eat. However, Einsteinâ€™s bagel eatery is in the same bld outside. The staff were very helpful and nice during our stay. The main entrance in located on the east side of the bld on Deerborn. We used valet parking and it was without incident, quick. The pool is what is to be expected in a moderate priced hotel. It is not an Olympic sized pool, and yes there are kids swimming in the pool with all fun they bring to the game. The whirlpool is smaller and was the worst part of the trip. It was very salty, either on purpose or icky, not sure. Didn't stay there long. The pool was nice, the kids loved swimming at night and seeing all the lights of the city. We saw the fitness room and it looked good. The rooms were awesome! My kids like it, not huge but just right. Towels, bathroom and blankets were all good. The TV was nice, it swiveled so you could either lay on the bed or sit on the couch and watch TV. Lots of plugs to plug in electronics. I didnâ€™t prefer the sick outside the bathroom, but they were clean. I would have liked something to place clothes on in the bathroom instead of the toilet tank. There was no shelf or table top to use to keep things off of the floor. We walked back from the theater to the hotel about 4-5 blocks. A nice place to stay if youâ€™re going to a play, as most are right close to each other.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: td397
Reviews.Content: This property is new and immaculate. Very much enjoyed the stay and would recommend for individuals, families, business or pleasure. Great location - great amenities - overal - GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: westla4
Reviews.Content: We just spent a weekend at this hotel. I have nothing but good things to say about our experience. The location is perfect. You are about a 10 minute walk to the "blue line" that takes you to O Hare; literally a 5 minute walk to the "red line" that takes you everywhere else. We never felt like we needed a car. There is also a grocery store nearby(10 minute walk) if you want to go get wine/beer etc. and store it in the fridge. The room was very clean. Since there were only two of us, it was more than enough room. If you had more than that I could see it being a little cramped, but there is a small pull-out sofa. Even though you are right downtown, the room was very quiet. The breakfast area was the biggest I've seen in one of these hotels. They kept it well stocked the whole time.
