It is very busy and lots of people everywhere, but we always got more than enough to eat. It's very nice to have internet access in the lobby for checking quick e-mails and printing off boarding passes. We will definitely come again when we are fortuante enough to come back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “new and nice”
Reviews.Author: syh75287
Reviews.Content: My work booked the hotel for everyone (I think the rate was $249). They just opened up this hotel earlier this year. The hotel is attached to the residence inn. You go in through the revolving door and there is an elevator for springhill suites and another for residence inn guests. You go up a floor to the lobby. To the back is a lounging area to sit. To the right of it are a few computers and a printer so it is nice to print out your boarding pass when checking out of the hotel. It's all complimentary (internet & printing). To the left of the sitting area is the dining area for the complimentary breakfast. They had eggs, sausage, cereal, juices, waffles, etc. It's a very adequate offering for a free breakfast. The 24-hr "market" is nearby the check-in desk and is a small convenience stand that has drinks and snacks. I got the room with the king bed. all in all, it looked like the hotel pics because the hotel is still new and in it's first year. the complimentary internet access is a plus. it has a microwave and mini-fridge. The sofa has a pull-out bed. you get a flat screen tv to watch. my bathroom only had a shower, but that was fine for me. The bath floor towel had a small stain (rust colored), but I turned it over and used the other side. The shower floor could of been a bit more spotlessly clean, but maybe it's the poor choice in the material type, not sure. it was quiet and a pleasant stay. all the extras add up to make this a good pick.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenadd
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. We had never been to Chicago before and we found this hotel a true delight. Brilliant location, close to the Magnificant Mile, State Street and the Theatre District. Great for us as we wanted to visit all the sights and do lots of shopping. The staff are very helpful, and having breakfast included in the price was an added bonus. There is free access to the internet which we found useful. We bought tickets online to see Dirty Dancing at the Cadillac Theatre and it was amazing,we would definately recommend it. We also discovered a restaurant called the Grand Lux Cafe, this is the sister company of the Cheesecake Factory and you don't need to wait nearly as long for a table, You can find it beside Marshalls on Ontario Ave. We found some great bargains by visiting the Chicago Premium Outlet Centre you can book this tour through greyline tours. We had time to see most of the sights but we would recommend the John Hancock tower instead of the Sears Tower. Much better views and you get an audio tour included. The "Windy City" really is a fab place to visit and we will definately be back and wouldn't hesitate to stay in the Springhill Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DDKU
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Springhill Suites over the Labor Day holiday this year. What a great hotel. First, location is great. Dearborn is a busy area with tons of places to eat within easy walking distance. The staff of the hotel was very helpful and pleasant. We left our camera down in the car after it was valet parked and they quickly went down and grabbed it for us. The rooms are a little small, but for our family of 3, that was not a big deal. We didn't spend a ton of time in the room anyway. My wife is tough to please on hotels so I was happy when she smiled and said it was to her liking. She was very happy with the cleanliness of the room. Overall, you can't go wrong with this place. We got it for $119 labor day special so I really considered it a great deal. I gave it 4 stars because I have to reserve the 5 star rating for those exceptional places.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: BethMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short stay in Chicago and were very pleased with our stay at the SpringHill Suites. While some have posted criticisms about the room sizes, we felt the design of the rooms was so smart that you didn't need the extra room (drawers inside a closet actually works very well). There were 4 of us in a room with 2 double beds and sofa sleeper, and we were fine. In fact, we ordered take-out dinner and sat very comfortably in the sitting end of the room. The rooms were exceptionally clean, bright, and we appreciated the modern style. One of the most important things about a hotel stay is your ability to actually sleep. Our beds were extremely comfortable, and even though the hotel was full during our stay, we didn't hear any noise when we were in our room. As others have stated, the staff is very friendly and helpful. We had not been in our room long when someone from the hotel knocked on our door to make sure we had everything we wanted. Finally, I just want to add that the hotel does not scrimp where many in its price range do. The towels are very good quality, and the shower is great, and as I've already stated so are the beds, and wall thickness. Give up a little square footage and in return receive better quality is worth it for me.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - great for tourists”
Reviews.Author: jwith2boys
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several downtown chicago hotels, and I liked this the best. It is brand new and shares the property with residence inn (they are really two sides of the same hotel - they share a common check in desk, pool, breakfast, etc.) The rooms are very modern, average sized, very clean and nicely furnished. Unlike other chicago hotels with a cramped lobby, you have to take an elevator to floor 2 to get to the lobby - and it is very nice. They have a very good free continental breakfast with hot eggs, waffles, and the usual cold foods. There is free internet in the rooms. There is also a nice (but not big) indoor pool, whirlpool and nice fitness room. Overall I would highly recommnd this, expecially for tourists or families visiting chicago. It is close to the river - you can walk to Michigan Ave, the water taxis, etc.

Reviews.Title: “True Tips about Springhill Suites Chicago”
Reviews.Author: cooldoctor1
Reviews.Content: Here are some actual true tips about the April 2008 built Springhill Suites in Chicago, River North, which is a nice but not super special hotel where the Baskets family spent four nights in August 2008. Our room had two double beds (no queens ever available--every room same, single king or two doubles plus pullout sofa) and a pull out sofa. It has a small fridge, a microwave, a desk and chair, and is very neuveaux in designâ€”see many tripadvisor photos of the rooms. The rooms are very long and narrow, and although there is a nice floor-to-ceiling window view of the city (higher floors betterâ€”26 floors plus 27th fl pool), the rooms feel startlingly tight. If one is looking for spaciousness, then these rooms are not it. The dresser is inside the closet, you will stumble across the pull-out bed in open position, and the bathroom with sink outside it is tight and has a walk-in closet feel. These rooms are great for two people; four is tight. The fridge, microwave, in-room free wifi and free local calls are welcome touches. The staff is extremely courteous and helpful, right from check-in. The mornings have a free breakfast of simple eggs, sausage, oatmeal and the like. If youâ€™ve stayed at any Marriott Residence Inn or Fairfield Inn, itâ€™s similar, Make your own waffles, that sort of thing. But nice, and free. I did not use hotel parking to comment on it, but driving in Chicago is horrendous in general, and I lived here for five years. Merchandise sales tax isâ€”hold your breathâ€”10.25% as of this writing. So, buy your camera, batteries, film, underwear and other non-grocery items at home before you get here. Wondering if the Mob still runs Chicago, because I need to find a loan shark just to afford the sales tax. Hotel tax similarly criminal. Chicago Restaurant tax nearly 11%! Includes Mickey Ds and any eatery. The Springhill lobby is decorated with funky, modern minimalism and is pleasingâ€”this hotel is in the same building and shares the same entrance as the Marriott Residence Inn Chicagoâ€”see reviews of that hotel and pick the one with the best deals/rates when you stay here. Same building. I would do plenty of rate shopping as, in this area, this hotel is not as nice (although newer) than the Marriott Renaissance on One Wacker Drive up the streetâ€”but in general that hotel is pricier. So, if youâ€™re getting this one at full price and that one at a discount, that one is better. The swimming pool at this Springhill Suites is, in a word, abysmal. A backyard pool is larger, and it plus the hot tub had more people than Iâ€™ve ever seen in a pool in my life. For the number of rooms in this building, the pool was a complete disaster, loaded with peeing children, stressed parents, and littered with towels and trash. Some people would go to a city hotel for an indoor oasis in the wintertimeâ€”this is not the place for that. Every night, same scene. I honestly wonder if the building fire code is broken with that many screaming people in a pool the size of two king sized beds. There is a workout area adjacent to the swimming pool with LifeFitness brand elliptical trainers and treadmills, TVs and weights which is serviceable. Better choice, run along the Chicago lakefront. There are 9 coin-op laundry machines ($1 wash, $1 dry) right next to the gym area. The key feature of this hotel is its location: 2 blocks from Harry Careyâ€™s Restaurant and House of Blues, within 4 blocks of Hard Rock, Rock N Roll McDâ€™s, Sportsmart, Chop House, and Michigan Av. Thereâ€™s a CVS two blocks away and Walgreens four blocks away and Navy Pier is about 8 blocks away. It is, in a word, the quintessential location for all of your Chicago activities if you plan to walk. Eateries are all around this place within a couple blocksâ€”dozens and dozensâ€”and the area is safe. Blues on Clark, other clubs and bars are two blocks away. Watertower Place 6 blocks away. The only area slightly furtherâ€”about ten blocks-- is Millennium Park and Grant Park, so if your whole vacation is being there and seeing the museums and Soldier Field and theater district around those parks, then you should stay on the south side of the river (e.g. One Wacker Drive Marriott Renaissance is closer). Or take the bus or shed some shoe leather (go on, itâ€™s good for you) from Springhill Suites. Frankly, as any Chicagoan knows, staying in the area right around Grant Park on lower Michigan Avenue is not desirable, particularly at night: desolate, more vagrants selling Streetwise, that sort of deal. But Marriott Renaissance is fine as it is on the river. So, youâ€™d be better staying here on North Dearborn at Springhill for most of the tourist attractions in Chicago. For singles or those â€œon the prowlâ€�, the Dearborn area is superb as you can walk to the best clubs in all of Chicago (e.g. Excalibur, The Redhead Piano Bar) and there are three adult bookstores within eyeshot of the Springhill Suites. There is a Starbucks and an Einstein Bagel one block away. Suggest www.maps.live.net and placing address 410 North Dearborn in and checking a birds eye view and you will learn plenty about where this hotel is located. Very sweet. So, all in all, I like the newness, but can see that this hotel will someday become dated and worn by travelers who tend to slam bang around in the tiny rooms.. The rooms are claustrophobic, and I know, we all say â€œwell, Iâ€™m just going to be sleeping there, thatâ€™s allâ€�, but in the end, size does matter. I urge you to grab the book or the laptop and simply, as I am doing while I write this review, sit in the lobby and enjoy some light and space. All that said, the rates are good, the location is premiere, and the staff is very friendly. With the room amenities such as microwave, plus the wifi and continental (mostly) breakfast, the place is strong. It is the future for hotels, in small ways, such as no ice vending machines on the floors to save space and noise, to large ways such as middle priced rooms, with amenities (fridge, et cetera) but very tight rooms to fit as many lodgers as possible in the hotel. A â€œcityâ€� hotel by any standard, not a resort, not overly posh, but for now, hip and trendy (cues from The Standard in California). Just leave your swim trunks at home. Plenty of others have added photos of the rooms, so I added some of the exterior and the lobby. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bastrop52
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at this hotel recently with husband and son. None of us had ever been to Chicago so we weren't sure exactly where in the city to book our hotel. The Springhill Suites turned out to be a great location--convienenant to the Magnificent Mile shops, Navy Pier, the Chicago River, and tons of restaurants. We flew into Midway airport so we rode the train in to the Clark/Lake station. From there the hotel was a very short walk. The hotel shares its entrance and building with the Marriott Residence hotel. There were plenty of cabs available outside although we did not use them. We used the trains, buses and walked. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful with all concerns. The room was very nice--especially since this is a new property. We really liked the seating area and big flat screen TV. Also the free internet access. The free breakfast was great. It featured both hot and cold selections each morning. Overall I'd have to give this 2 thumbs up...would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel - Wonderful Location - Reasonbly Priced”
Reviews.Author: TravelPrincess
Reviews.Content: Staying at Springhill Suites was a treat. Only a few months old this hotel's location was great - about 3 minute walk to Michigan Avenue and lots of restaurants and bars nearby. It was across from the "House of Blues" and right next door to the Westin River North. Check-in was a breeze. The staff was friendly and very efficient. Parking was a bit steep at $42/day. If you have time and patience - you might want to drive around and look for a parking lot cheaper than this. Their hot breakfast buffet was ample - with a waffle station, sausages, eggs, a variety of breads/pastries, fruits, juices and coffee/tea/hot cocoa. It was a bit odd that the "Check-in Lobby" was a floor up, and that it shared also the main lobby of the Residence Inn. As you exit the elevator, Springhill was on the left and Residence inn was to the right. The rooms were spacious and very clean. There was a flat screen TV that was conveniently positioned to be view from either the bed or the "living room" area. The comfy L shaped couch doubled as a sofa bed too. Beds are comparable to Westin's Heavenly bed. The suite had a coffee maker, microwave and a refrigerator. We had free WiFi for 24 hours and that was very convenient. We got a discounted rate of $159 per night from Marriott's website. We were very happy with the Springhill Suites and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “New, clean room, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Audrey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in late July. Hotel is very new and is in the same building as the Marriott Residence Inn (share same elevator bank to lobby, different check-in areas). My room was modern and very clean. Breakfast area was well stocked and had plenty of room to sit. Hotel convenient to business or pleasure, with a number of restaurants nearby. I had requested a king room and was given a king handicapped room. It seemed well set up for someone who was handicapped (although since I am not, I will admit I am no expert). As such it had an open shower area and entire tiled bathroom area with floor drains which seemed like they would work well if you had limited mobility. It seemed slightly like a hospital bathroom to me - not exactly the relaxing spa bath experience I was hoping for after a long trip and day of meetings. Otherwise, the hotel worked very well for me and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended - Nice Clean Room - Good CS -”
Reviews.Author: WeAreCool
Reviews.Content: Booked through hotel website, same price as all others. Don't spend extra on corner king suite - was not really a 2 bedroom suite. but Customer Service from Valet to Front Desk was above average for other hotels I've stayed in chicago (2/3x year) Would stay again - FREE breakfast buffet was way above average as well, hot/cold quick options. Room was ready by 11am on a Sunday check in which was a nice suprise. Pool was VERY very small, not crowded, on the 27th floor which was nice, kids still had fun - lots of chlorine, but I suppose that's a good thing. hot tub average (small size)

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: teddysdad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and were pleased with everything. There was a good breakfast (only drawback was that it never changed). The location was good - short walk to buses and trains. We got a good rate from travelzoo - would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Springhill Suites / Great location, great for families”
Reviews.Author: goldmt2
Reviews.Content: Went to a couple Cubs games last week with my son and decided to stay downtown. Booked the SpringHIll Suites and was very very pleased. I'll make this quick and to the point: Positives: Location is AWESOME. It's right by everything. The redline on Grand, tons of great places to eat, excellent shopping...it's easy to get to if you're driving, and again, in terms of location, it can't be beat. We got a great price. Basically 250 bucks got me the room, taxes and various chargees, a free buffet breakfast and parking. (in fact $41 of the $250 was parking related.) Staff was friendly and professional. We had requested early checkin and was actually able to get in our room by 11:00 Room was nice. Was it the nicest room I've ever been in? Nope. But it was spacious, clean and was a perfect spot for my son and I. If you are looking for 4 star luxury, this isn't it, but if youi are looking for nice, new, clean, well located, family friendly, this place is perfect. Negatives: I don't really have any complaints about this place at all. $41 seemed a little steep for parking, but it is downtown, and we did get unlimited in / out privledges, so I'm not really complaining about the hotel itself, moreso I'm just kinda bummed that I have to pay that much to park in the first place. Bottom line...I do recommend this hotel. It was a great buy, great location, and nice room. And by the way, the breakfast wasn't bad either. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: punkgirl107
Reviews.Content: I booked the trip through the Entertainment Book. There really wasn't a problem with the hotel. It was simply preferences. The staff was very accomedating. Two rooms were booked. The rooms were on separate floors. We requested that the rooms be on the same floor, connecting preferably. The rooms we were given were next to each other. The hotel offers a complimentary breakfast as well as tea and coffee throughout the day. Very nice feature. I am not a breakfast person but my travel companions are and enjoyed this feature. The hotel is new so the rooms were very clean. However I like to relax by taking a bath. The rooms only had showers. I was rather disappointed. The hotel did not have ice machines, instead they had bags of ice in there "market place" that guests could take. The problem with this is that the bag frozen into a huge ice cube that did not fit into the ice bucket and certainly was not able to be placed into glasses. The decor of the rooms looked as if they were decorated by Ikea. I expected a more refined look from a Marriot hotel.

Reviews.Title: “From start to finish, wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Dede53
Reviews.Content: It's understandable to be apprehensive about staying in a brand new hotel, wondering if all the 'glitches' will be a problem. From the time of our arrival on July 2nd till our departure on July 6th it was a tremendous experience. The front desk is exceptional. A week before our arrival I had to make arrangements to pick up a birthday cake, they-the front desk-were able to give me three bakeries within one block of the hotel. By the way, the cake was tremendous. They were so very courteous and helpful throughout our entire stay. The hospitality did not stop at the front desk, the personnel manning the valet, the housekeeping staff, and the people working the breakfast service, all top notch. Wonderful location, close to great restarurants, public transportation, and all the things you'd like to do while visiting Chicago. Our room was great! Wonderful beds, flat screen TV, small fridge, internet access, and quiet! I would definitely make this my preference for any future stays in Chicago.
